0.title: 29 people injured as KSRTC bus meets with an accident in Bengaluru
0.article_body: As many as 25 people were injured and four others seriously injured after a Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) bus met with an accident in Bengaluru on Monday. The bus had about 45 passengers on board, DCP (West Division) Sanjeev Patil said. According to reports, bus collided with a metro pillar after the driver, who was speeding, lost control.

1.title: Shoojit told Deepika 'Don't have to please anyone as Piku': Piku screenwriter
1.article_body: 'Piku' screenwriter Juhi Chaturvedi said film's director Shoojit Sircar told actress Deepika Padukone that she did not have to please anyone as 'Piku'. "[Sircar said] It doesn't matter whether Rana likes you or not...whether Bashkor likes you or not," Juhi said, adding, "Deepika said 'I don't know what this film is about, but I can sense that this is me'."

2.title: Ukraine won't accept Russian dictatorship: Germany
2.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Sunday said that there can be no peace in Ukraine under Russian dictatorship. "Ukraine will not accept that, and neither will we," he said in a speech to mark the 77th anniversary of the end of World War II in Europe. Scholz further said that Ukraine will prevail in the ongoing conflict.

3.title: How can KKR still qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs?
3.article_body: KKR are ninth on IPL 2022 points table with eight points. They'd require to win each of their remaining three matches with big margins to advance with 14 points and a superior net run-rate. Their fate will also depend on other teams. They'd need MI to win their last three matches and RCB to lose their remaining two matches.

4.title: Verstappen wins Miami GP to cut Leclerc's championship lead to 19 points
4.article_body: Red Bull's Max Verstappen won the inaugural Miami Grand Prix to secure his third race this season and 23rd of his career. Ferrari's Charles Leclerc finished second while his fellow Ferrari driver Carlos Sainz finished third. Verstappen, who's second on the season's driver standings, has 85 points with Leclerc at the top having 104 points.

5.title: Sean Bean wins Leading Actor, Jodie Comer bags Leading Actress at BAFTA TV Awards
5.article_body: Sean Bean won the award in the Leading Actor category, while Jodie Comer bagged the Leading Actress award at the BAFTA TV Awards 2022 on Sunday. Sean won the award for his performance in 'Time' and Jodie was awarded for her role in 'Help'. Gabrielle Creevy and Jo Hartley's comedy-drama 'In My Skin' won the Best Drama Series award.

6.title: 'Sex Education' actor Ncuti Gatwa to play lead in 'Doctor Who'
6.article_body: Ncuti Gatwa, known for portraying Eric Effiong in 'Sex Education', will replace Jodie Whittaker as the lead in British science-fiction television programme 'Doctor Who'. Speaking at the BAFTA TV Awards 2022, Ncuti said, "It's been emotional...I woke up crying then I started dancing. I'm glad it's finally out." Jodie became the first woman to play the Time Lord in 2017.

7.title: Rupee hits all-time low of 77.42 against US dollar
7.article_body: The Indian rupee fell to an all-time low of 77.42 against the US dollar on Monday, Reuters reported. Asian markets were lower on Monday as US stock futures fell on fears of more policy tightening from the Federal Reserve and strict lockdown in Shanghai impacting global growth, according to Reuters.

8.title: BSF shoots down Pak drone carrying 10.67 kg of heroin in Punjab
8.article_body: The BSF Punjab Frontier tweeted on Monday that its troops had foiled a smuggling attempt in Amritsar through a drone which had come from Pakistan. It said that the troops had shot down the drone that was carrying nine packets of suspected heroin weighing 10.67 kg in a bag. In April, BSF had shot down another Pakistani drone in Amritsar.

9.title: Earlier I wasn't comfortable wearing jeans because of my weight: Shehnaaz
9.article_body: Speaking about her fashion choices that have evolved lately, actor-singer Shehnaaz Gill said, "Earlier, I had limited earnings, so I did styling according to that. Also, I wasn't comfortable in jeans back then because everyone can't carry them with that weight." "I was...comfortable mostly in suits. But now...I'm making more money, I can style myself better," she added.

10.title: Blast in firecracker factory in UP's Saharanpur, 5 dead
10.article_body: A blast took place in a firecracker factory located in the Govindpur village of Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur district. During the time of the incident, six people were inside the factory out of which five got killed while the remaining one has sustained serious injuries, police said. The deceased are identified as Rahul, Sumit, Karthik, Sagar and Vardhan Pal.

11.title: 5 dairy owners booked for using banned oxytocin on buffaloes in Guj
11.article_body: Five dairy owners in Gujarat's Palanpur were booked following a raid by authorities for allegedly using oxytocin injection, which is banned for retail sale, on buffaloes to increase their milk production. The matter came to light after two tourists, who're part of an animal welfare organisation, visited some dairy farms. Over 12 oxytocin bottles were confiscated, a police official said.

12.title: GST Council may consider highest 28% tax on cryptocurrencies: Report
12.article_body: The GST Council is considering levying a 28% tax on cryptocurrencies and their related services, as per a report. While the proposal is likely to be discussed in the next GST Council meeting, its date is yet to be decided. Notably, the Finance Ministry has already imposed a 30% income tax on earnings from virtual digital asset transactions.

13.title: Kohli can find form only by playing, not by resting: Dilip Vengsarkar
13.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Dilip Vengsarkar has suggested Virat Kohli to keep playing to find his form. "If he is failing and he takes off, doubts will start creeping into his mind. That is not the way to go about it," explained Vengsarkar. Kohli has registered three golden ducks and has scored 216 runs in 12 games so far in IPL 2022.

14.title: Hyd murder against Islam, woman's brother had no right to kill: Owaisi
14.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi took to Twitter to talk about the man who was murdered by his wife's family in Hyderabad. "The murder of Nagaraju in Hyderabad is against Islam. The girl married him out of her own will...Her brother had no right to kill her husband. It is a criminal act and worst crime as per Islam," Owaisi said.

15.title: Don't allow bars to open till 3 am in Delhi: BJP writes to police
15.article_body: Delhi BJP has written a letter to Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana asking him not to allow bars to stay open till 3 am in the national capital. This comes after CM Arvind Kejriwal-led government decided to relax the timings to further improve the city's nightlife. Delhi BJP Spokesperson Praveen Shankar Kapoor said the move will create law and order problems.

16.title: Giving batting advice to Virat Kohli is like showing torch to sun: Amit Mishra
16.article_body: Reacting to Sportskeeda asking its followers what advice they'd give to Virat Kohli amid his poor form, veteran leg-spinner Amit Mishra tweeted, "Giving batting advice to Kohli is like showing torch to sun." He added, "Just a matter of few games before he comes back strong as ever. He did it after 2014 England tour and he'll do it again."

17.title: Anarchist Kejriwal, separatist forces trying to enter HP together: Tejasvi
17.article_body: BJP leader Tejasvi Surya on Sunday reacted to the Khalistan flags incident in Himachal Pradesh and called AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal an "anarchist". "Not a coincidence that anarchist Kejriwal and separatist forces are trying to enter Himachal Pradesh together. Himachal must identify and isolate such forces of destruction," Surya tweeted.

18.title: BJP looking for another Ayodhya issue: Cong leader on Gyanvapi mosque case
18.article_body: Congress leader Pramod Tiwari said BJP is trying to turn the Gyanvapi mosque case into an Ayodhya-like issue so that they can politicise. "BJP's condition is like a wingless bird after Ayodhya's verdict as they can't fight politics on jobs, inflation and 'achhe din'", Tiwari added. "They are looking for another Ayodhya issue so that they can politicise," he stated.

19.title: Police seizes 800 kg of marijuana consignment in Hyderabad
19.article_body: The Cyberabad Metropolitan Police seized a UP-bound marijuana consignment worth ₹2 crore in Hyderabad. A total of 800 kilograms of marijuana was kept inside 64 different packets, police said. Notably, the consignment was being taken to UP's Bulandshahr from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh. Two people have been arrested while the search is on to catch the supplier and other suspects.

20.title: Ozone levels cross safe limit in Delhi; JLN Stadium worst-affected
20.article_body: The level of ground-level ozone crossed the safe limit in many parts of Delhi as heatwave conditions pushed temperature to unusually high levels, data from Delhi Pollution Control Committee (DPCC) showed. The highest values were recorded at JLN stadium. Dr Karni Singh Shooting Range, Nehru Nagar, Mandir Marg, RK Puram and Narela also breached the safe limit.

21.title: Not a big fan of Maths, wasn't good at it in school too: Dhoni on CSK's playoffs chances
21.article_body: On being told by commentator Murali Kartik that CSK mathematically still have the chance to qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs, MS Dhoni said, "I'm not a big fan of Maths...even in school I wasn't good at it." He added, "You write your own fortune...If we [advance], it's very good, but if we don't, it's not the end of the world."

22.title: I will do my best to stay alive: Musk to his mother after 'mysterious dying' tweet
22.article_body: Soon after Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a tweet about his "mysterious death", his mother Maye Musk commented that it wasn't funny. Responding to her, Musk wrote, "Sorry! I will do my best to stay alive." Musk's 'dying' tweet came after he shared a statement by the Roscosmos director that threatened him for supplying "fascist forces" to Ukraine.

23.title: BJP, RSS turning Lord Ram who's symbol of love into Rambo: Baghel
23.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel during an interview accused the BJP and RSS of turning Lord Ram who is a "symbol of love" into "Rambo". He also claimed that Lord Hanuman's old pictures show him as being "meditative and devotional" but the BJP and RSS are making him "angry and aggressive". Furthermore, he said that BJP's "idea of nationalism is imported".

24.title: India reports 3,207 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 20,403
24.article_body: India has reported 3,207 COVID-19 cases, 3,410 recoveries and 29 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,451 COVID-19 cases and 40 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 20,403, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,093.

25.title: Pic of MS Dhoni 'eating' his bat goes viral, Amit Mishra says 'He does it to keep it clean'
25.article_body: A picture of MS Dhoni using his teeth on his bat during CSK's match against DC went viral. A Twitter user commented, "Reminds me of childhood...Dhoni eating bat." "He does that to remove tape of...bat as he likes [it] to be clean. You won't see a single piece of tape or thread coming out of MS' bat," Amit Mishra tweeted.

26.title: Investigating it myself: Scindia after IndiGo denies boarding to differently-abled child
26.article_body: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said he is investigating the matter himself wherein IndiGo denied boarding to a differently-abled child at the Ranchi airport. He added that appropriate action will also be taken. A social media post along with a video of the incident went viral on Sunday after it detailed how IndiGo staff denied boarding to the child.

27.title: I'm happy south films RRR & KGF 2 are doing great numbers at box office: Yami
27.article_body: Speaking about films like 'RRR' and 'KGF: Chapter 2', actress Yami Gautam said focusing on the story and script and allowing a director's vision to come to life on the big screen is a key determining factor in the success of these films. "The way they're doing great numbers at the box office. I'm really happy about that," she added.

28.title: Dad had no money for mom's discharge, Chetan Anand gave him ₹400: Amjad's son
28.article_body: Late actor Amjad Khan's son, Shadaab Khan, said his father did not have money to pay for his mother, Shehla Khan's discharge from the hospital when he was born. "[My dad] was ashamed to show his face. [Late] Chetan Anand...happened to see my father holding his head in corner...[he] gave him ₹400...so that my mother and I could come home."

29.title: British airline EasyJet to take out seats from planes so it can fly with fewer crew
29.article_body: British low-cost airline EasyJet plans to remove seats on some of its planes so it can operate flights with fewer cabin crew. The airline, which has been facing a staff shortage, is cancelling around 30 flights daily. It will be removing the back row from 60 of its A319 jets, which will limit the passengers to 150 instead of 156.

30.title: Shiv Sena's marriage was arranged with BJP, it ran with others: Union Minister
30.article_body: Union Minister Raosaheb Patil Danve on Sunday said Shiv Sena's marriage was arranged with the BJP but it "ran away" with others. "Shiv Sena left us (BJP) for the Chief Minister's post (in 2019). We did not leave it. It is up to the people to decide whether they have run away from the BJP or not," Danve added.

31.title: I thought we were getting better but that is not the case: Pant
31.article_body: After they suffered their sixth loss in the ongoing IPL season, DC captain Rishabh Pant said CSK outplayed them in all departments in their match on Sunday. "We have played a lot of close games...I thought we were getting better but that's not the case," he added. CSK posted 208/6 and dismissed DC for 117 to win by 91 runs.

32.title: Only 60 CNG pumps for 2 lakh vehicles in Pune, wait time 1.5 hours: Report
32.article_body: There are only 60 CNG pumps in Pune which serve over 2 lakh vehicles, stretching the waiting time for refuelling to about 1.5 hours for commuters, said a report. "Whenever I go to fill up CNG…there are long queues. So, mostly I prefer to go at night as it takes 30 minutes to one hour," said a commuter.

33.title: No enmity with BJP or RSS but violence shouldn't be tolerated: Gehlot
33.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Sunday said that there is no enmity with BJP or RSS but violence should not be tolerated in any form. "No one should accept violence and those who are ruling should condemn it, no matter which party, caste or religion they belong to," Gehlot added. He was addressing a function at Pinjrapole Gaushala in Sanganer.

34.title: Pune to continue having cloudy weather over next few days: IMD
34.article_body: Pune will continue to witness cloudy skies over the next few days, India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted. On Sunday, Pune’s Shivajinagar recorded a maximum temperature of 40.7°C, Pashan 40.8°C and Lohegaon 40.1°C. The minimum temperature recorded in the city was 21.4°C. On Monday, the maximum temperature is predicted to go up to around 40°C.

35.title: India have to find a way to get Karthik in their T20 WC side: Vaughan
35.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has said Team India will have to find a way to get RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik in their squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "With the way that Karthik is playing, he might have to put the commentary microphone down for another T20 World Cup," added Vaughan. Karthik scored 30*(8) against SRH on Sunday.

36.title: BITS offers MBA in Digital Business for working professionals
36.article_body: India will need nine times as many digital skilled workers by 2025, according to an Amazon Web Services report. Aligning with the same, BITS has revealed that its MBA in Digital Business is designed for working professionals and enables participants to learn about emerging technologies and how these technologies can be leveraged to design, build, and manage digital businesses.

37.title: 18-yr-old boy drowns at Pune dam while taking video with friends
37.article_body: An 18-year-old boy drowned at Pune's Khadakwasla Dam after he was washed away when he climbed the pumping station wall and dived. The incident occurred on Saturday while the deceased and his two friends were taking selfies and videos. "Youths today...try doing tricks...to take a picture or a video, which is risky," a city-based rescue and trekking group member said.

38.title: Himachal Pradesh seals borders, books SFJ chief over Khalistan flags at Assembly
38.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Police have booked Sikhs for Justice (SFJ) leader Gurpatwant Singh Pannun under UAPA and "sealed" the state's borders after Khalistani flags were put up at state Assembly complex in Dharamshala. Himachal Pradesh police chief Sanjay Kundu also ordered beefing up of the state-wide security after the SFJ's announcement of a Khalistan "referendum day" on June 6.

39.title: 8 including 6 women die, 20 injured as lorry, mini-truck collide in T'gana
39.article_body: Eight people, including six women, were killed in a collision involving a mini truck and a lorry in Telangana's Kamareddy district on Sunday evening. Twenty people were also injured during the incident that took place around 5 pm on Sunday. Police said that two people died on spot while three others died on way to the hospital.

40.title: Disturbed by friend's long phone call, 23-yr-old man kills him in Punjab
40.article_body: A 23-year-old man, Satyam Kumar, killed his 33-year-old friend, Mohammad Iman, after he reportedly got disturbed by Iman's long telephonic conversation in Punjab's Ludhiana. The two were drinking together on night of May 6 when Iman got a phone call. When Iman disconnected the call, Kumar assaulted him for disturbing him and slit his throat using a razor.

41.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read after CSK record biggest win of season?
41.article_body: CSK have moved to the eighth position on the IPL 2022 points table after recording the biggest win of the season against DC on Sunday. LSG, GT, RR and RCB constitute the top four, followed by DC, SRH and PBKS, who have 10 points each. MI are currently placed last, while KKR are ninth.

42.title: If I die under mysterious circumstances, nice knowing ya: Musk after Russian threats
42.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has tweeted, "If I die under mysterious circumstances, it's been nice knowing ya." Shortly before this, Musk shared a post that he said was a statement by the Roscosmos director Dmitry Olegovich Rogozin to Russian media that accused Musk of supplying "fascist forces in Ukraine". "Elon, you'll be held accountable like an adult," the statement read.

43.title: B'luru Customs arrest passenger hiding ₹47 lakh-gold in underwear
43.article_body: Bengaluru Customs tweeted on Sunday that a passenger was arrested for allegedly attempting to smuggle gold in paste form, worth over ₹47 lakh, by hiding it in underwear. The passenger had arrived from Abu Dhabi. This is the second such incident in two days after customs seized gold worth over ₹50 lakh from a passenger who reportedly hid it similarly.

44.title: Man, sister give 2 dozen water bottles to Hyd Police on duty; pic surfaces
44.article_body: A Hyderabad police officer shared picture of brother and sister distributing water bottles to police officials on duty. "Vivek of Google India and his sister Vaishnavi, an engineering student, distributed two dozen of water bottles to the police personnel on bandobust duty in hot sun, near Malakpet Fire Station...they said it's their responsibility," the officer wrote.

45.title: Our little girl is finally home: Priyanka Chopra as she shares 1st pic with daughter
45.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra took to Instagram to share the first photo with her daughter Malti Marie on the occasion of Mother’s Day. Sharing the photo that featured Nick Jonas also, she wrote, “After 100 plus days in the NICU, our little girl is finally home...Our next chapter begins now, and our baby is truly a badass. Let's get it MM!"

46.title: 4th match, 4th 100+ score, it's a privilege to watch Pujara: Sussex Cricket
46.article_body: After batter Cheteshwar Pujara scored his fourth successive century for Sussex in County Championship Division Two match against Middlesex, Sussex Cricket took to Twitter to praise him. "It's a privilege to watch Pujara," they wrote. Pujara scored an unbeaten 170 off 197 balls, which includes 22 fours and three sixes. He scored two double centuries(201*, 203) and one ton(109) before.

47.title: CSK record biggest win of IPL 2022, defeat DC
47.article_body: CSK defeated DC by 91 runs on Sunday to register the biggest victory (by runs) of IPL 2022. CSK have now won four matches in the tournament. The previous biggest victory (by runs) in the tournament had come on Saturday, when LSG defeated KKR by 75 runs. CSK will next face MI on Thursday.

48.title: Theekshana has been the steal for CSK, one of the best buys in IPL: Jaffer
48.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said CSK spinner Maheesh Theekshana, who has taken 12 wickets from eight matches so far in IPL 2022, has been outstanding. He added the Sri Lankan is one of the best buys in IPL. "He's been the steal for CSK...has taken five wickets in the powerplay...also has four wickets in the death," he further said.

49.title: Thousands of Lebanese living abroad vote in parliamentary election
49.article_body: Thousands of Lebanese citizens living overseas began voting in a parliamentary election on Sunday. Nearly 2 lakh Lebanese citizens living abroad are eligible to vote in the election, the first since the start of the economic crisis in the country. Notably, voters in Lebanon will cast their ballots on May 15.

50.title: Despite many roadblocks for DC this season, they haven't given up: Jaffer
50.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said DC haven't given up despite facing many roadblocks like unavailability of foreign players, injury woes and covid concerns from the start of IPL this season. "Credit must be given to them, but still, they are...in the hunt for the playoffs...they might get on a roll soon," he added. DC are currently fifth in the standings.

51.title: Army, police rescue 2 people stuck in J&K river after 5-hr operation
51.article_body: The army and police in J&K's Kishtwar district on Saturday rescued two people from drowning in the Chenab river following a nearly five-hour-long rescue operation. The pair got stuck after attempting to cross the river in their earth-mover. Both were sitting on the roof of the vehicle when they were finally rescued in pitch dark, the officials said

52.title: Badshah buys Audi Q8 worth over ₹1.23 crore, shares picture
52.article_body: Singer Badshah has bought an Audi Q8 worth over ₹1.23 crore and shared a picture while posing with it, on his Instagram handle. The rapper already has several cars including a Rolls Royce Wraith worth over ₹6 crore, which he purchased in 2019. The Audi is reportedly finished in the 'Dragon Orange Metallic' shade.

53.title: Leopard injures policeman, officers in Haryana; attack caught on video
53.article_body: An SHO and two forest department officials leading a rescue operation team to catch a leopard were injured in Haryana's Panipat on Saturday night. A video of the incident showed the animal attacking the rescue team members and it was later successfully tranquilised. The SHO and one of the forest officials were hospitalised but are stable, an official said.

54.title: Didn't win the Oscar as Will Smith beat me, not physically: Benedict
54.article_body: 'Doctor Strange' actor Benedict Cumberbatch made a joke about Will Smith slapping Chris Rock at the Oscars during his Saturday Night Live monologue. "I didn't win the Oscar...I was [beaten] by Will Smith," he said. Benedict quickly added, "Not physically." Will won the Oscar for Best Actor for his performance in 'King Richard'. Benedict was nominated in the same category.

55.title: BJP to play role of responsible Opp'n in Punjab: BL Santhosh
55.article_body: BJP National General Secretary BL Santhosh on Sunday said his party will not allow any compromises with Punjab's interests and will play the role of a responsible Opposition in the state. He also asked BJP leaders and workers to make the public aware of the "false propaganda and hollow promises" made by the Aam Aadmi Party.

56.title: Elon Musk planning a new Twitter product codenamed 'X': Report
56.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk, who's acquiring Twitter for $44 billion, plans to launch a new Twitter product codenamed "X", according to his investor presentation obtained by The New York Times. Musk expects to launch the product in 2023 and estimates it would have nine million subscribers in its first year and 104 million subscribers by 2028, the NYT reported.

57.title: US imposes new sanctions on 27 Gazprombank, 8 Sberbank executives
57.article_body: The US on Sunday imposed new sanctions against three Russian television stations and banned 27 executives from Gazprombank in response to Ukraine's invasion of Russia. This is the first time that the US has imposed sanctions involving Russian gas exporter Gazprombank. The new sanctions also included eight executives from Sberbank, and Moscow Industrial Bank and its 10 subsidiaries.

58.title: We'll fight as long as we're alive: Ukrainian fighters in Mariupol
58.article_body: Captain Sviatoslav Palamar, a deputy commander of Ukraine's Azov Regiment at Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol, on Sunday said, "We'll continue to fight as long as we're alive". "We can die at any moment...Our message is don't waste our efforts," another fighter said. The fighters are the last remaining Ukrainian resistance against Russian forces in the city.

59.title: Retail investors have become shock absorbers in equities: FM
59.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said retail investors have played a key role in the markets in the last two years. "[They] have shown...what they can do by standing up and becoming shock absorbers, unlike FPIs," she stated. Her statement comes as foreign portfolio investors pulled out ₹6,417 crore from the Indian stock markets in the first week of May.

60.title: School holds 35 students hostage over non-payment of fees in UP's Bareilly
60.article_body: A school in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly allegedly held at least 35 students hostage over non-payment of their tuition fees. The school administration reportedly locked up the students in a room and the matter came to light when their parents came to pick them up. Meanwhile, the school's parents' organisation has decided to file a complaint against the school authorities.

61.title: Mauritius PM launches 2nd phase of India-Mauritius flagship metro project
61.article_body: Mauritius PM Pravind Jugnauth inaugurated the Quatre Bornes to Phoenix segment of India-Mauritius flagship Metro Express project on Sunday. The project was financed from the $190 billion Line of Credit extended from India in January this year. Prime Minister Narendra Modi along with his Mauritian counterpart had inaugurated the first part of the metro via videoconferencing in 2019.

62.title: Bihar civil services exam cancelled after question paper leaked, probe launched
62.article_body: The Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) has cancelled the 67th Combined (Preliminary) Competitive Examination after the question papers were leaked and shared on social media. Bihar Lok Seva Aayog said that the DGP has been requested to get the matter investigated by the Cyber Cell. The Commission had constituted a three-member inquiry panel to probe the leak.

63.title: Army organises 'Educative Health Forum' for women in J&K's Machhal
63.article_body: The Indian Army organised an "Educative Health Forum" in the remote Machhal sector of J&K's Kupwara District this month to counsel women on health issues, education and government schemes. "This is the first time...such a step has been undertaken so close to...Line of Control," the army said. The army had collaborated with a Bengaluru health coach to conduct the sessions.

64.title: US wanted to set up military bases in Pak, wouldn't allow it: Ex-PM
64.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan has stated that the US wanted to establish military bases in the country during his tenure, something he would have never allowed. Khan stated that the US wanted bases in Pakistan to "conduct" counter-attacks in case of terrorism in Afghanistan. Notably, Khan had earlier alleged that a 'foreign conspiracy' had tried to topple his government.

65.title: Syrian Prez meets Iranian Prez during surprise visit to Iran
65.article_body: Syrian President Bashar al-Assad made a surprise visit to Iran on Sunday, meeting Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei and President Ebrahim Raisi. Notably, this is Assad's second trip to Iran since the start of Syria's civil war in 2011. Assad's government has managed to survive due to support from Iran and the military intervention by Russia, according to Reuters.

66.title: Maha govt to seek cancellation of bail given to MP Navneet, husband
66.article_body: The Maharashtra government will seek cancellation of bail given to MP Navneet Rana and her MLA husband Ravi Rana in the Hanuman Chalisa issue, public prosecutor Pradeep Gharat said. A Mumbai court granted bail to the couple on May 4 (Wednesday) and they walked out of jail on Thursday. They were arrested on April 23.

67.title: 'Install cameras at mosques', suggests Owaisi amid communal clashes
67.article_body: AIMIM president Asaduddin Owaisi has suggested that high-resolution CCTV cameras be installed at mosques following recent incidents of communal clashes. While alleging that "Muslims are routinely blamed for problems during communal incidents" he added that whenever any religious procession passes through these areas it should be telecast live so that "people know who are the ones pelting stones".

68.title: Himachal Pradesh CM orders SIT probe into Khalistan flags incident
68.article_body: After Khalistan flags were found tied to the main gate and boundary wall of the Himachal Pradesh Legislative Assembly, CM Jairam Thakur said he has directed police to constitute a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to probe the incident. "Strict action will be taken against the accused...They will not be...spared," Thakur added. "I condemn the cowardly incident," the CM further said.

69.title: 'Arjun Reddy' actor Rahul Ramakrishna announces upcoming wedding
69.article_body: Actor Rahul Ramakrishna, known for portraying Shiva in 2017 Telugu film 'Arjun Reddy', announced on Sunday that he will be marrying his girlfriend Bindu. The actor also shared a picture of the two kissing, writing, "Getting married, finally, soonly!" Rahul has said Bindu was a fan of his work and the two connected when she offered him a lift home.

70.title: Hope hero says he's male Nushrratt: Nushrratt on female Ayushmann tag
70.article_body: Actress Nushrratt Bharuccha reacted to being called a female Ayushmann Khurrana during the trailer launch event of 'Janhit Mein Jaari'. She said she has worked with Ayushmann in 'Dreamgirl' and added, "I'm sure he has rubbed off...in the right way." "Hope someday some hero says, he's the female Nushrratt Bharuccha," she added. Nushrratt plays a condom salesgirl in the film.

71.title: Preity shares pic of twins, says 'Beginning to understand motherhood'
71.article_body: Preity Zinta shared a picture of her twins and mother on social media on Sunday to mark Mother's Day. She wrote, "From thinking of myself first to learning to put my kids first, I'm beginning to understand what motherhood is all about." Preity further wrote she hopes her kids are more appreciative of her than she was of her mother.

72.title: Former J&K Education Minister Harsh Dev Singh joins AAP
72.article_body: Former J&K Education Minister and National Panthers Party (NPP) chief, Harsh Dev Singh, joined AAP in presence of party leader Sanjay Singh in New Delhi on Saturday. "The problems plaguing J&K can only be addressed by eradicating corruption and ensuring good governance, like...AAP has done in Delhi," Singh said after joining. Notably, he's the third NPP leader to join AAP.

73.title: WeWork India turns profitable, reports 40% y-o-y growth
73.article_body: Bengaluru-based WeWork India turned profitable for the first time during January-March 2022. The co-working space company reported an operating margin of ₹25 crore during this period, with around 40% year-on-year growth. CEO Karan Virwani said the company is expecting 33% growth in revenue in 2022 at around ₹1,000 crore, compared to 2021's revenue of ₹750 crore.

74.title: Woman cheated of ₹6.47 lakh in online investment fraud in Chandigarh
74.article_body: Police in Chandigarh have booked an unidentified online fraudster for cheating a woman of ₹6.47 lakh after posing as a Bima Lokpal employee. The complainant said the accused called her to discuss an old insurance policy's pending balance amount and insisted she deposit money to receive a bonus on a refundable investment. Her money was, however, never returned.

75.title: Man rapes 14-yr-old mentally challenged niece in Punjab, booked
75.article_body: A 29-year-old man has been booked for allegedly raping his 14-year-old mentally challenged niece in Punjab's Ludhiana on Saturday. "I had gone out for some work, leaving my 14-year-old daughter...at home," the victim's mother said adding she returned to find the accused sexually assaulting her. Police suspect that the accused had been sexually assaulting the victim for a long time.

76.title: Australia cricketer Head, fiancée's flight skids into a field after emergency landing
76.article_body: Australia cricketer Travis Head's fiancée Jessica Davies took to Instagram to reveal how their flight slid into a field after an emergency landing at an island while they were returning from their holiday in Maldives. Calling it terrifying, Jessica wrote, "It was like watching a movie." She added that they had to wait for four hours for a rescue plane.

77.title: Du Plessis, Karthik then De Silva, the 3D effect for RCB: RP Singh
77.article_body: Following RCB's 67-run win against SRH in IPL 2022, RP Singh tweeted, "Faf Du Plessis, Dinesh Karthik...then Wanindu Hasaranga De Silva! The 3D effect for RCB." Du Plessis top-scored with an unbeaten 50-ball 73, while Karthik hit 30*. De Silva took a five-wicket haul. "Brilliant five-fer from De Silva made sure they stayed in the race to...play-offs!" tweeted Harbhajan Singh.

78.title: No religious events will be allowed on UP roads: CM Adityanath
78.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has warned that no religious event will be allowed on the roads of the state to avert communal tension. Adityanath said that such events should take place inside the premises of religious places. Last month, Adityanath had said that no religious procession should be taken out without permission and loudspeakers shouldn't cause inconvenience to others.

79.title: I blacked out, couldn't breathe: Bella Hadid on her Met Gala dress
79.article_body: Bella Hadid, in an interview, talked about her Met Gala appearance and the dress she wore. Talking about how she "blacked out", she said, "People literally stand there for 20 minutes…I don't think I was out there for more than three minutes...Don't know if that was my anxiety, or maybe the waist was giving cinch and I couldn’t breathe."

80.title: Had no intention of physically harming Kejriwal: BJP leader Bagga
80.article_body: Delhi BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga on Sunday said he had no intention of physically harming Kejriwal. "All I had said was that till [Kejriwal] apologises (for his statement on The Kashmir Files), I will not let him live peacefully. This does not mean that I had any intention of physically harming him," Bagga said.

81.title: I've studied every song sung by Lata Mangeshkar: Palak Muchhal
81.article_body: Singer Palak Muchhal, who will be paying tribute to late singer Lata Mangeshkar in the series 'Naam Reh Jaayega', has said, "Lata ji has been my ultimate inspiration." She added, "I've grown up listening to her songs, learning her songs. Palak further stated that she has "literally" studied every song sung by the late singer "like a chapter".

82.title: No amount of gerrymandering can change situation in J&K: Abdullah
82.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah on Saturday said that no amount of gerrymandering can change the ground situation in J&K and Ladakh. "People have made it a point to punish BJP and its proxies for all they have done to J&K. Inflation, unemployment and development deficit have compounded the worries of our people immensely," he added.

83.title: 1 out of every 10 unicorns in the world today has been founded in India
83.article_body: With Open becoming India's 100th unicorn (startup with a valuation of $1 billion or above), one out of every 10 unicorns in the world has been founded in India, the government said. India is now home to 100 unicorn startups with a total valuation of $332.7 billion. Within the first four months of 2022, 14 Indian startups achieved unicorn status.

84.title: At times we didn't know how we'll pay rent, you didn't panic: Smriti on her mother
84.article_body: Women and Child Development Minister Smriti Irani paid tribute to her mother on Mother's Day and said, "You have never had it easy." Sharing a picture with her mother Shibani Bagchi, Irani said, "There were times when I didn't know how...next month's house rent could be afforded but I never saw you panic, never heard you curse our fate."

85.title: Faced hurdles getting into OTT when I was barely out of TV: Rithvik
85.article_body: Rithvik Dhanjani said he, initially, faced "some hurdles" while being considered for OTT projects when he was "barely out" of the TV industry. "But in recent times, the industry is more accepting, they know...we know our jobs," he stated. "I get offered different kinds of parts. The casting directors I've heard from feel...I can pull them off," he added.

86.title: 55-year-old Russian climber dies at camp on Mount Everest
86.article_body: A 55-year-old Russian climber died at camp I of Mount Everest, a Nepali official confirmed on Sunday. The deceased, Pavel Kostrikin, fell sick at camp II and died after he was brought back to camp I, the official added. Kostrikin's demise is reported to be first death of a foreigner on peak in current climbing season which began in March.

87.title: Delhi reports 1,422 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 5,939
87.article_body: Delhi reported 1,422 new COVID-19 cases on Sunday as compared to 1,407 cases recorded on Saturday. The city saw zero deaths in the last 24 hours while the positivity rate stood at 5.34% as compared to 4.72% reported on Saturday. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the city was 5,939 as compared to 5,955 on Saturday.

88.title: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau makes unannounced visit to Ukraine
88.article_body: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Sunday made an unannounced visit to Ukraine amid the war in the country. Trudeau visited the Ukrainian town of Irpin, which was retaken from Russian forces in late March. In a statement, Trudeau's office said, "The PM is in Ukraine to meet with President (Volodymyr) Zelenskyy and reaffirm Canada's unwavering support for...Ukrainian people."

89.title: Mom said give it your all, I continually put in good work: Madhuri
89.article_body: Madhuri Dixit, on being asked about the secret of her success, said her mother told her to give it her all and put in hard work with dedication. She further said she started very early but began questioning her decision as it wasn't working out. "But I continued to put in...good work...'Tezaab' proved to be an overnight success," Madhuri added.

90.title: Ukrainian troops have retreated from Popasna: Luhansk Governor
90.article_body: Ukrainian troops have retreated from the eastern Ukrainian city of Popasna, Serhiy Gaidai, the governor of the Ukrainian breakaway region of Luhansk said on Sunday. Gaidai's remarks came as the head of Russia's republic of Chechnya, Ramzan Kadyrov, confirmed that his troops had taken control of Popasna. Russia launched a military offensive in eastern Ukraine last month.

91.title: Won't blame Munawar Faruqui for not winning 'Lock Upp': Anjali Arora
91.article_body: Anjali Arora said that she will not blame her friendship with Munawar Faruqui as the reason for not winning the reality show 'Lock Upp'. "I won't like to make that an excuse. My friendship with Munawar is a different side," she stated. "I may not understand a lot about reality shows but I will never blame him," Anjali added.

92.title: Around 500 doctors join BJP in Gujarat ahead of Assembly elections
92.article_body: Around 500 doctors joined the BJP in Gujarat's Gandhinagar on Sunday. The doctors were inducted into the party in the presence of CM Bhupendra Patel and state BJP chief CR Paatil. Gujarat Assembly elections are slated to be held later this year. Paatil had earlier asked party workers to continuously work for the next six months after May 4.

93.title: Chelsea beat Man Utd to win Women's Super League for 3rd time in a row
93.article_body: Chelsea won FA Women's Super League title for the third consecutive time after a 4-2 come-from-behind win against Manchester United on Sunday. Chelsea scored three goals after being 2-1 down at half-time. Arsenal beat West Ham United 2-0 and finished second on 55 points, just one behind Chelsea. Manchester City secured the final Champions League spot as they finished third.

94.title: Woman kills live-in-partner suspecting affair, burns body in Guj
94.article_body: A woman allegedly killed her live-in partner and then burnt his body over suspicion of an affair in Gujarat's Rajkot. The incident took place on Friday and the accused was arrested on Saturday after her neighbours informed the police. The woman tried to mislead the police by telling them a fake story, but later confessed to her crime, reports said.

95.title: Unemployment rate fell from 10.3% to 8.7% in Oct-Dec 2021: NSO
95.article_body: The unemployment rate for people above 15 years in urban areas slipped from 10.3% to 8.7% between October and December 2021, the National Statistical Office (NSO) data revealed on Sunday. Among males, the unemployment rate dipped to 8.3% in October-December 2021 compared to 9.5% a year ago. Meanwhile, among females, the rate fell from 13.1% to 10.5% y-o-y.

96.title: World no. 10 Jabeur beats Pegula to win 1st WTA 1000 title in Madrid
96.article_body: Tunisia's Ons Jabeur defeated 12th-seeded Jessica Pegula 7-5, 0-6, 6-2 at Madrid Open to win her first WTA 1000 title on Saturday. Notably, the 27-year-old became the first Arab woman to win a 1000 title. It was world number 10 Jabeur's 12th clay-court match win, the most among players this season. Jabeur won the final in 1 hour 54 minutes.

97.title: LIC IPO booked 1.79 times on Day 5; policyholders booked 5.04 times
97.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) public issue was subscribed 1.79 times on the fifth day of bidding on Sunday. The offer has received bids for 29.07 crore equity shares against the IPO size of 16.2 crore equity shares. The policyholder portion was booked 5.04 times, followed by the employee portion, which was booked 3.79 times.

98.title: Israel to end mandatory COVID tests at Tel Aviv airport from May 20
98.article_body: The Israeli Health Ministry on Sunday announced an end to mandatory COVID-19 tests for people arriving at Tel Aviv's Ben Gurion airport from May 20. The authorities have cited a decline in coronavirus cases for easing the restriction. However, foreigners would still have to test negative for coronavirus before boarding a flight to the country, the ministry said.

99.title: 5000-year-old jewellery factory found in Haryana's Rakhigarhi, pics released
99.article_body: The Archaeological Survey Of India (ASI) has found the remains of a 5,000-year-old Indus Valley era factory in Haryana's Rakhigarhi village. The skeletons of two women, jewellery, utensils and other artefacts were also found during the excavations, pictures of which have been released. The structure of some houses and a kitchen complex were also discovered.

100.title: SHO, 2 forest officials on rescue op hurt in leopard attack in Haryana's Panipat
100.article_body: A Station House Officer (SHO) and two Forest Department officials, who were leading a rescue team to catch a leopard in the Behrampur village of Haryana's Panipat, sustained injuries in the operation. The leopard was later successfully tranquilised. "I salute their bravery and courage," Panipat SP said, while sharing a video footage of the incident.

101.title: Contest election against me: Navneet Rana challenges Uddhav Thackeray
101.article_body: Amravati MP Navneet Rana on Sunday challenged Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray to contest an election against her, adding that the people of Mumbai and Lord Ram will teach Shiv Sena a lesson in civic polls. "I will work hard, and with honesty, and win the election and he will come to know of people's power," she said.

102.title: MP to launch startup policy, will provide experts to entrepreneurs
102.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government will launch the MP Startup Policy on May 13, State MSME Minister Om Prakash Sakhlecha stated. It will provide institutional ease of doing business, infrastructure, procurement policy and other incentives to startups. This includes the concept of 'MP Startup Centre', which will have a dedicated office, a head/mentor for every startup and experts from relevant field.

103.title: Woman alleges repeated rape by Rajasthan minister's son, says 'he shot obscene videos of me'
103.article_body: A 23-year-old woman from Jaipur has alleged that Rohit Joshi, the son of Mahesh Joshi, Rajasthan's Minister for Public Health Engineering, raped her on multiple occasions over a year. She said that while he promised to marry her, he would beat her up and record obscene videos of her. The Delhi Police has registered a zero FIR in the matter.

104.title: Ranbir, Alia had planned wedding in South Africa: Neetu Kapoor
104.article_body: Neetu Kapoor, speaking about Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding, has revealed that the duo had planned to get married in South Africa. "Ranbir and Alia had planned so much that 'we'll go to South Africa, we'll do a recee', and eventually, where did they do it? At their home," Neetu stated. The duo tied the knot on April 14.

105.title: 2 held with IED packed with RDX in Punjab; police say 'possible terror attack averted'
105.article_body: Punjab Police on Sunday found an explosive device packed with around 1.5 kilograms of RDX and arrested two men in a village in the Tarn Taran district. The IED, packed in a metal box weighing over 2.5 kilograms, was also equipped with a timer, detonator, battery and shrapnel, police said. Police further claimed that they averted a possible terrorist attack.

106.title: TN govt revokes ban on 'Pattina Pravesam' ritual amid outrage
106.article_body: Tamil Nadu government on Sunday revoked its ban on 'Pattina Pravesam' ritual, during which devotees carry the Dharmapuram mutt's seer on a palanquin. The DMK government which earlier banned the tradition citing violation of human dignity, has now said that the ritual will take place on May 22. The move comes after several devotees and opposition parties opposed the ban.

107.title: MP police book railway official for raping female subordinate
107.article_body: The Additional Divisional Railway Manager of West Central Railway Zone's Bhopal Division has been booked for allegedly raping a female subordinate, police said. According to the victim's complaint, the ADRM allegedly exploited her for getting a compassionate job. Meanwhile, her husband also lodged a complaint against his own wife and ADRM, calling his marriage a part of a conspiracy.

108.title: Hearts of Americans with Ukrainian mothers: Jill Biden to refugees
108.article_body: During a meeting with women and children who fled the conflict in Ukraine, US First Lady Jill Biden said, "The hearts of the American people are with the mothers of Ukraine." Biden met the refugees in Slovakia on the occasion of Mother's Day. Biden also expressed gratitude to officials and non-government organisations for supporting and aiding the refugees.

109.title: Woman says Rajasthan minister's son raped her several times, shot obscene videos of her
109.article_body: A 23-year-old woman from Jaipur has alleged that Rohit Joshi, the son of Mahesh Joshi, Rajasthan's Minister for Public Health Engineering, raped her on multiple occasions over a year. She said that while he promised to marry her, he would beat her up and record obscene videos of her. The Delhi Police has registered a zero FIR in the matter.

110.title: BJP’s policies behind unemployment, declining family income: Akhilesh
110.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday alleged that due to the "faulty economic policies" of the BJP government, the income of every household has come down and unemployment has risen in the country. He said that inflation is increasing every day and the common man is feeling shattered under BJP's rule, which had promised the dream of 'achhe din'.

111.title: 2 arrested for assaulting off-duty soldier in J-K's Poonch
111.article_body: Two persons have been arrested after an off-duty soldier was attacked with sharp-edged weapons at his home in J&K's Poonch earlier this month. The prime accused, Gangandeep Singh and Simranjeet Singh, were arrested on Sunday after special teams were constituted to investigate the case. The weapon of offence and vehicle used during the assault have been seized, an official said.

112.title: He's equally good against pace, spin: Watson on DC all-rounder Powell
112.article_body: Calling Rovman Powell a "world-class batsman", DC assistant coach Shane Watson said the all-rounder is on top of his game against pace and spin bowling. "It took him just one innings (against KKR) to find his rhythm. From then on, his mindset and technique from ball one has been absolutely outstanding," he stated. Powell has scored 202 runs so far.

113.title: Won't get your form back by sitting in change room: Gavaskar on Kohli
113.article_body: Sunil Gavaskar opened up about Virat Kohli's form and said the ex-India captain shouldn't miss matches for Team India to take a break. "India matches should be no. 1 priority...Sitting in the change room, it's not going to get your form back," Gavaskar stated. "The more you play, the more chances you have [of] getting your form back," he added.

114.title: FM Sitharaman gets water for NSDL MD during her speech at an event, video viral
114.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media wherein Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman could be seen offering water to the Managing Director of National Securities Depository Limited, Padmaja Chunduru. While Chunduru asked for water from hotel staff during her speech, Sitharaman came on stage and offered her water during the event held to celebrate the silver jubilee of NSDL.

115.title: Umran Malik shouldn't compromise on bowling fast: Nikhil Chopra
115.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Nikhil Chopra said SRH's Umran Malik shouldn't compromise on bowling fast as it is a "rare commodity". Nikhil added that Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Dale Steyn could help Umran learn skills. "With that skill and pace, it will be a perfect blend," Nikhil stated. Umran bowled the fastest delivery of IPL 2022 after clocking 157.0 kmph versus Delhi Capitals.

116.title: 5 Guj farmers inject buffaloes with oxytocin to raise milk yield, held
116.article_body: Five dairy farmers from two villages in Gujarat's Banaskantha were booked for allegedly giving oxytocin injections to buffaloes to enhance milk production, police said on Sunday. "The police acted after two complainants said they visited cow sheds in the two villages and saw these farmers using the drug on milch buffaloes," said Inspector BR Patel of Palanpur Taluka Police Station.

117.title: Man chases lion with his tractor in Gujarat's Amreli; arrested
117.article_body: Police have arrested a man for allegedly chasing a lion with his tractor in a forest area in Gujarat's Amreli, an official confirmed on Sunday. A purported video of the incident also surfaced online, after which the accused's vehicle was seized, the official added. The accused, identified as Rahul Baldaniya, was booked under provisions of the Wildlife Protection Act.

118.title: US First Lady Jill Biden makes surprise visit to Ukraine amid war, video released
118.article_body: US First Lady Jill Biden made a surprise visit to Ukraine on Sunday, amid the ongoing Russian onslaught. A video released by Jill Biden's Press Secretary showed her hugging Ukrainian First Lady Olena Zelenska in Uzhhorod village bordering Ukraine. She also met Ukrainian refugees in eastern Slovakia at a refugee centre in Kosice.

119.title: Wanindu Hasaranga records best bowling figures of IPL 2022
119.article_body: RCB leg-spinner Wanindu Hasaranga on Sunday recorded the best bowling figures in IPL 2022 so far. The 24-year-old registered figures of 4-1-18-5 against SRH. The previous best bowling figures were recorded by SRH fast bowler Umran Malik, who had taken five wickets for 25 runs against GT on April 27. RCB defeated SRH by 67 runs today.

120.title: What is the passwordless sign-in tech that Google, Apple & Microsoft teamed up for?
120.article_body: Google, Microsoft and Apple on May 5 announced they are teaming up to expand support for a common passwordless sign-in standard created by the FIDO Alliance and the World Wide Web Consortium. Through the new system, sign-ins will be possible through the same actions that users take to unlock their devices, like fingerprint or face verification or a device PIN.

121.title: Leaves of Kolkata civic body staff being cancelled amid Cyclone Asani alert
121.article_body: The Kolkata Municipal Corporation (KMC) has put its employees and disaster management teams on alert in view of the formation of cyclonic storm Asani, which is likely to intensify further, Mayor Firhad Hakim said. Leaves of all employees are being cancelled to deal with any emergency evolving due to the cyclone, which is unlikely to hit the city, Hakim added.

122.title: Discussing baby names with Deepika, don't want others to steal them: Ranveer
122.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has revealed that he has a list of baby names and is discussing them with his wife actress Deepika Padukone. He further said that he is fascinated by unique names but is very secretive about the list because he doesn't "want people to steal" the names. "I don't want them to get common," the actor added.

123.title: Irrfan in 'Piku' car scene was "brilliance beyond words": Big B
123.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan has stated that late actor Irrfan Khan's performance in a scene in 2015 film 'Piku' was "brilliance beyond words". Irrfan's character was about to drive Deepika Padukone and her family to Kolkata. Amitabh stated that Irrfan gave a look to Deepika's character in the scene and "conveyed an entire paragraph of dialogues" in "those magical few seconds".

124.title: Class 8 Punjab boy sodomised by 3 men for a year; accused arrested
124.article_body: Three men, including two brothers, were arrested for allegedly sodomising a Class 8 boy in Punjab for a year. The 16-year-old boy's father claimed his son had been depressed for past few days. He narrated his ordeal when his father asked him about it. "The trio had also threatened him of dire consequences if he told anybody," his father added.

125.title: Sidhu to meet Punjab CM Mann tomorrow to discuss state's economy
125.article_body: Former Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu will meet Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann in Chandigarh on Monday. In a tweet, Sidhu said he will discuss with the CM matters regarding the revival of Punjab's economy. "Punjab's resurrection is only possible with an honest collective effort," Sidhu added.

126.title: 60-year-old dies after police assaults her in UP, alleges family
126.article_body: A 60-year-old woman died after being assaulted by the police in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad, her family alleged on Sunday. The victim, Radha Devi, was "violently shaken" by a policeman, following which she collapsed and died. Additional SP (City) Mukesh Chandra Mishra said a police team had reached Devi's house on Saturday evening to check on her four jailed sons.

127.title: Pushp Kumar Joshi takes over as HPCL Chairman & MD
127.article_body: Pushp Kumar Joshi on Sunday took over as the new Chairman and Managing Director of Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL), India's third-largest oil refining and fuel marketing company. Prior to this, Joshi was the Director-HR of the state-owned firm. He has replaced Mukesh Kumar Surana, who was superannuated from services on April 30, 2022.

128.title: RCB hand SRH their 4th straight defeat in IPL 2022, get to 14 points
128.article_body: RCB on Sunday handed SRH their fourth straight defeat in IPL 2022. RCB have now won two matches in a row and are currently fourth on the points table with 14 points. Faf du Plessis top-scored for RCB with 73*(50), while RCB leg-spinner Wanindu Hasaranga took five wickets. RCB will next face PBKS on Friday.

129.title: Gangster from Middle East offered ₹1.25cr owed by producers: Amjad Khan's son
129.article_body: Late veteran actor Amjad Khan's son Shadaab has revealed that a gangster from Middle East offered to give them ₹1.25 crore owed by producers after his death. He added that his mother refused, saying her husband never took favours from the underworld. "My father had a habit of helping people and letting go of a lot of money," Shadaab added.

130.title: Shanghai tightens lockdown to attain 'zero-COVID' goal by late May: Report
130.article_body: Shanghai is tightening its COVID-19 lockdown restrictions in a bid to curb the spread of the virus, Reuters has reported. Curbs will likely vary across the city's 16 districts but movement restrictions will reportedly remain in place till late May to attain the 'zero-COVID' goal. Shanghai reported over 3,760 local asymptomatic COVID-19 cases on Sunday.

131.title: Indian men's team beat Germany 5-0 in their opener at Thomas and Uber Cup
131.article_body: Indian men's badminton team beat Germany 5-0 in their Group C opener at Thomas and Uber Cup Finals in Bangkok on Sunday. World Championships bronze medallist Lakshya Sen, Kidambi Srikanth, HS Prannoy won their respective singles matches, while doubles pairs of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy-Chirag Shetty and MR Arjun-Dhruv Kapila emerged victorious in doubles matches. India will face Canada on Monday.

132.title: DC to bowl first against CSK, injured Ravindra Jadeja replaced by Shivam Dube
132.article_body: DC captain Rishabh Pant won the toss and elected to bowl first against CSK in their IPL 2022 clash on Sunday. DC have made two changes to their playing XI, with KS Bharat and Axar Patel replacing Mandeep Singh and Lalit Yadav. Meanwhile, Shivam Dube has replaced injured Ravindra Jadeja in CSK's playing XI.

133.title: Jet Airways granted security clearance by Home Ministry
133.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs has granted security clearance to Jet Airways which is planning to relaunch commercial flight operations in the next few months, PTI reported citing an official document. The Jalan-Kalrock Consortium-led airline operated a test flight in Hyderabad last Thursday. It will now conduct proving flights, following which the DGCA will grant it the air operator certificate.

134.title: Bike rally held to raise awareness about soil conservation in Mumbai
134.article_body: About 200 people took part in a bike rally on Sunday in Mumbai to raise awareness about soil conservation. "Throughout history, motorcycling communities have rallied for great causes. Mumbai's motorcycle community has come out...to amplify the message to Save our Soil," the chief ride organiser said. The rally was organised as part of 'Save Soil' campaign launched by Sadhguru.

135.title: 20-yr-old student robbed of bike worth ₹60,000 by 4 men in Pune
135.article_body: A 20-year-old student was robbed of his bike worth ₹60,000 by four men in Pune district's Chinchwad area, police said. The man was with his friend near a school when the incident took place. The accused allegedly beat them up with bamboo and kicked them before snatching the keys to the bike.

136.title: Took a bit of time to move on: MI pacer Sams on his 35-run over vs KKR
136.article_body: Reflecting upon his 35-run over in MI's five-wicket loss against KKR in IPL 2022, MI pacer Daniel Sams said, "It took a bit of time to move on from that and see what I can learn." Against GT on Friday, Sams defended nine runs in final over of the match to help MI register their second win this season.

137.title: 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' one of greatest movies ever: Sam Raimi
137.article_body: Filmmaker Sam Raimi, who directed the Tobey Maguire-starrer 'Spider-Man' trilogy, has called Tom Holland's 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' "one of the greatest movies" he has ever seen. He further said that he admires the film's director Jon Watts, adding that watching it was an emotional experience. Sam also said he "laughed his head off" when he heard the film's plot.

138.title: Delhi-NCR schools revising timings, restricting outdoor activities amid heatwave
138.article_body: Schools in Delhi-NCR are revising school timings, restricting outdoor activities, stocking ORS and glucose sachets and motivating students to remain hydrated due to severe heatwave conditions. Earlier this week, parents of students had urged the Delhi government to either revise the school timings or advance the summer holidays. The IMD said Delhi may experience heatwave conditions from May 10-12.

139.title: Bommai got Karnataka CM post in exchange for money: Siddaramaiah
139.article_body: Leader of Opposition in Karnataka Assembly and Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Sunday said Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai got the Chief Minister's post in exchange for money. "RSS has made him Chief Minister, following their instructions is enough for him," he said. "Basavaraj Bommai is not an elected Chief Minister, he is an appointed Chief Minister," Siddaramaiah added.

140.title: Retd Delhi officer who raped minor changed appearance to evade arrest
140.article_body: Delhi Police arrested a retired Assistant Central Intelligence Officer (ACIO- Grade II) for allegedly raping his friend's minor daughter and informed that the accused changed his appearance to evade arrest. In the guise of getting the victim a job, the accused took her to a hotel in Karol Bagh, where he allegedly intimidated the minor and raped her.

141.title: UK announces additional 1.3 bn pounds in military aid to Ukraine
141.article_body: The UK has pledged an additional 1.3 billion pounds in military support and aid to Ukraine, as the British government emerges as one of the strongest supporter of the Ukrainian resistance. The extra funding will come from a reserve used by the UK for emergencies. The UK has already provided anti-tank missiles, air defence systems and other weapons to Ukraine.

142.title: Loans worth ₹5,000cr approved for women, SC/ST entrepreneurs in FY22
142.article_body: More than 23,000 loans, worth around ₹5,000 crore, were sanctioned during FY22 to women and SC/ST entrepreneurs under the government's Stand-Up India scheme, government data showed. As of March 31, 2022, a total of 1.35 lakh applications amounting to around ₹30,200 crore were sanctioned. The scheme was launched in April 2016.

143.title: Pune Police chief to hold Q&A session on Twitter tomorrow
143.article_body: Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta will hold a live question and answer (Q&A) session on Twitter on May 9 (Monday), the city police said. It asked people to feel free to post their questions using the hashtag LiveWithCPPuneCity. "Look forward to chatting with as many of you as possible! Questions, inputs, and feedback...all welcome," the Commissioner said.

144.title: Got ₹45 lakh bill for plane hired for Punjab CM Mann's 3-day Guj visit: State govt
144.article_body: Punjab government got a ₹44,85,967 lakh bill for a plane hired for CM Bhagwant Mann's three-day visit to Gujarat in April, the state's Department of Civil Aviation has said in response to an RTI query. CM Mann visited Gujarat from April 1 to 3 with AAP National Convener Arvind Kejriwal. They attended the virtual launch of the party's poll campaign.

145.title: User accuses IndiGo of denying boarding to differently-abled child; Airline replies
145.article_body: A Twitter user shared a detailed account of how a differently-abled child was denied from boarding an IndiGo flight at the Ranchi airport. The user alleged that the airline said the passenger would be a risk to others and "needed to quiet down to become travel-worthy". Meanwhile, the airline tweeted that the team was looking into the matter.

146.title: 50-yr-old Nigerian man's naked body found in toilet in Palghar; 6 held
146.article_body: A 50-year-old Nigerian national's naked body was found in a toilet of a building in Palghar's Vasai, police have confirmed. According to police, six Nigerians had killed the victim a few days back, who were traced and consequently arrested from Guwahati. Police suspect that a failed financial transaction over drugs could be the motive of the crime.

147.title: Tesla accuses ex-engineer of returning dummy laptop after stealing data secrets
147.article_body: Tesla has sued former engineer, Alexander Yatskov, for allegedly transferring confidential information on its supercomputer technology to his personal devices and turning over a "dummy" laptop to cover up theft. Yatskov quit in May and has refused to return the stolen data, claimed Tesla. The company also accused him of lying on his resume about his expertise and work experience.

148.title: Pune's Sassoon Hospital's NICU saves 12,000 infants in 5 years
148.article_body: Pune's Sassoon General Hospital's NICU (neonatal intensive care unit) has saved over 12,000 infants by providing treatment free of charge in the last five years. "Nothing can match the joy of rebirth of an infant on the face of the mother. It works as the driving force for us," said Dr Vinayak Kale, Dean, Sassoon General Hospital.

149.title: Bengaluru likely to witness rain or thundershowers in next 24 hours
149.article_body: Bengaluru is very likely to see rain or thundershowers in the next 24 hours, the India Meteorological Department said on Sunday. The city is expected to have a cloudy sky and the maximum temperature is likely to settle around 33°C. The IMD has forecast that surface winds are likely to be strong and gusty at times.

150.title: Looking at everyone's photos, I miss you more: Akshay on Mother's Day
150.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar on Sunday took to social media to share a picture with his late mother Aruna Bhatia to mark Mother's Day. He wrote in Hindi, "Not a day goes by when I don't think about you, but looking at everyone's Mother's Day photos makes me miss you even more." Akshay's mother passed away on September 8, 2021.

151.title: I reckon MS Dhoni will play another IPL season: Shoaib Akhtar
151.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said that CSK skipper MS Dhoni might play another IPL season before quitting. "Can't really predict what Dhoni does...I reckon he will play another season before he calls it a day," Akhtar said. "Or again, he might be part of the management," he added. The 40-year-old has scored 142 runs in 10 matches so far.

152.title: 60-year-old sets himself ablaze to stop eviction drive in Chennai
152.article_body: A 60-year-old street vendor in Chennai attempted self-immolation on Sunday to protest against Tamil Nadu government's encroachment eviction drive. Residents are resisting the water department's eviction drive, which has been going on for the last 10 days, while seeking time to move the Supreme Court over their eviction. The man suffered severe burn injuries and is critical, police said.

153.title: 70-yr-old Mumbai man molests 10-yr-old neighbour after luring her with chocolates
153.article_body: A 70-year-old man has been arrested in Mumbai for allegedly molesting his 10-year-old neighbour by inviting her to his place to play frequently by luring her with chocolates and biscuits. The incident came to light after the minor girl started behaving strangely when her mother probed her. Police claimed the accused would remove her clothes and touch her private parts.

154.title: Sri Lankan Opposition rejects Prez's offer to form interim govt
154.article_body: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), Sri Lanka's main opposition party, on Sunday said that it has rejected an offer by President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to form an interim government. Notably, President Rajapaksa has refused to quit office despite mounting pressure from protesters amid a severe economic crisis in the country. Rajapaksa has imposed a state of emergency in response to the protests.

155.title: B'luru residents complain of foul smell from sewage treatment plant
155.article_body: Residents of the Lingadheeranahalli area in Bengaluru have complained of foul smell emanating from a sewage treatment plant. The plant had been shut for five years before the Supreme Court overturned the National Green Tribunal's stay orders. Karnataka State Pollution Control Board chairman Shanth A Thimmaiah said he will visit the plant and look into the issue.

156.title: Virat Kohli bows down to Dinesh Karthik after his 375-strike rate knock, video goes viral
156.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli bowed down to his teammate Dinesh Karthik in the dressing room after the latter scored an unbeaten 30 runs off eight deliveries at a strike rate of 375 against SRH. Karthik's eight-ball knock included four sixes and a four. It helped RCB put up a total of 192/3. Karthik has scored 274 runs in IPL 2022.

157.title: News anchor Aman Chopra escaped arrest after UP Police made us wait: Raj Police
157.article_body: Rajasthan Police has alleged that UP Police didn't cooperate with its team that went to arrest news anchor Aman Chopra from his Noida home. "Our team was made to wait at the Noida police station and the accused had slipped away by then," said Dungarpur SP Sudhir Joshi. Chopra's house was found locked by the police team.

158.title: Roller coaster gets stuck mid-ride, riders left hanging upside down for 45 mins in US
158.article_body: A roller coaster ride at an amusement park in the US stopped and the riders were left hanging upside down for nearly 45 minutes due to a technical glitch. The amusement park later released a statement about this and said all riders were safely evacuated. The Flying Cobras ride sends riders through a 360-degree loop, flipping them six times.

159.title: Djokovic, because he's no. 1: Alcaraz on world's best tennis player
159.article_body: Carlos Alcaraz was asked to choose between Novak Djokovic and Rafael Nadal to name his pick as the world's best tennis player. To this, Alcaraz replied, "Djokovic, because he's No. 1. But I don't know what to say. Both of them are some of the best players of history." This comes after Alcaraz defeated Djokovic in the Madrid Open semi-finals.

160.title: Shoot me if Cong wins a single seat in J&K polls: Ex-Cong MLA
160.article_body: Ex-J&K MLA Mohammad Amin Bhat has asked people to "shoot" him at Srinagar's Lal Chowk if Congress bags a single seat in the union territory's Assembly elections. Bhat, who has been demanding that Ghulam Nabi Azad be declared Congress' CM candidate, stated party is "zero" without Azad. Notably, his comments come days after the delimitation process of J&K was finalised.

161.title: Future Enterprises to raise ₹3,000 cr from insurance arm sale: Report
161.article_body: Debt-ridden Future Enterprises is planning to raise ₹3,000 crore by selling its insurance business to pare debts and avoid going into insolvency, reports said. FEL will reportedly sell its remaining 25% stake in Future Generali India Insurance (FGIICL) for ₹1,250 crore. It may also sell its 33.3% stake in Life Insurance JV-Future Generali India Life Insurance (FGILICL) for ₹400 crore.

162.title: What Yuvraj, Kaif did was extraordinary: Nick on NatWest series final
162.article_body: Recalling the 2002 NatWest series final against India, ex-England cricketer Nick Knight said the team didn't know much about Yuvraj Singh and Mohammad Kaif at that point. Nick said his side did not expect Team India to chase a total of 325 runs after Sachin Tendulkar's dismissal. "For those two guys to do what they did was extraordinary," he added.

163.title: Exciting to see another Spanish teenager work his way up: Kim on Alcaraz
163.article_body: Ex-world number one Kim Clijsters took to Twitter to praise 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz after he became the first-ever player to defeat Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic back-to-back at same clay-court tournament at Madrid Open. "So exciting to see another Spanish teenager work his way up in our sport. Takes me back to 2004-05 when Rafa started his journey," she wrote.

164.title: Tamil Nadu girl donates piggy bank saving of ₹4,400 to Sri Lanka
164.article_body: A girl from the Ramanathapuram district in Tamil Nadu donated ₹4,400, she saved in her piggy bank, to Sri Lanka, which is facing its worst economic crisis. The Indian high commission in Colombo praised the girl. Sharing pictures of her, it tweeted, "Strength of bond between the people of India and Sri Lanka on display!!!!"

165.title: Petition in HC to open 20 rooms in Taj Mahal to verify presence of Hindu idols
165.article_body: A petition has been filed in Allahabad High Court's Lucknow bench seeking directives to the Archaeological Survey of India to open 20 rooms inside Agra's Taj Mahal to ascertain the presence of Hindu deities' idols. The plea cited claims by some historians and Hindu groups about the monument being an old Shiva temple. BJP's Rajneesh Singh has filed the petition.

166.title: Anil Agarwal sings bhajan with his mother on video call on Mother's Day
166.article_body: The daughter of billionaire Anil Agarwal took to Twitter to share a video of the Executive Chairman of Vedanta Resources singing a bhajan with his mother on the occasion of Mother's Day. "From feeding my belly with the most delicious ghee shakkar rotis, to helping me succeed in my goals...I owe it all to you, Maaji," Agarwal tweeted in reply.

167.title: Unable to get ‘kick’, MP man complains of liquor adulteration
167.article_body: A 42-year-old man from MP has complained to authorities about a shop allegedly selling adulterated liquor as he did not get a "kick" after consuming it. The complainant said that he's been consuming liquor for the last two decades and is aware of its quality and taste. Following his complaint, the Excise Commissioner has ordered a probe into the matter.

168.title: Prithvi Shaw hospitalised after fever, shares pic from hospital bed
168.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) opener Prithvi Shaw took to Instagram to share that he has been hospitalised. Sharing a picture from the hospital bed, Shaw wrote, "Admitted in hospital and recovering from fever. Thank you all for your good wishes. Will be back in action soon." Shaw had missed DC's previous match and won't feature against CSK tonight as well.

169.title: Heatwave conditions likely in 6 states in next few days, IMD releases list
169.article_body: IMD has said that heatwave conditions will prevail in some areas over Rajasthan from May 8 to 12. Heatwave conditions will also be experienced in north Madhya Maharashtra on May 8 and 9 and in Vidarbha and west Madhya Pradesh from May 9 to 12. They're also predicted in south Haryana-Delhi and south Punjab from May 10 to May 12.

170.title: He's impressed me the most: Sehwag on PBKS wicketkeeper-batter Jitesh
170.article_body: Praising Jitesh Sharma in ongoing IPL, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said the PBKS wicketkeeper-batter has impressed him more than wicketkeeper-batters Rishabh Pant, Ishan Kishan and Wriddhiman Saha. Sehwag added that he's wondering if Jitesh could be in contention for a spot in India's squad for 2022 T20 World Cup. Jitesh scored an 18-ball 38* in last game against RR.

171.title: PWD to hire anti-smog guns, sprinklers to control air pollution
171.article_body: Delhi's Public Works Department is planning to hire five to six anti-smog guns and truck-mounted water sprinklers to control air pollution in the city. The anti-smog guns will have a capacity to store 7,000 to 10,000 litres of water. The anti-smog guns spray nebulised water droplets in the air through high-pressure propellers, causing dust particles to settle down, reports said.

172.title: FPI ownership in equities falls to 19.5%, lowest since March 2019
172.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors' (FPIs) ownership in domestic equities of NSE500 companies fell to 19.5% in March 2022, according to Bank of America Securities India. This is its lowest level of FPI ownership since March 2019, when it was at 19.3%. FPI ownership was at its peak at 21.4% in December 2021. FPI ownership in March 2022 stood at $619 billion.

173.title: Ashok Gehlot has lost his mental balance: BJP MP Ram Kumar Verma
173.article_body: BJP's Rajya Sabha MP Ram Kumar Verma has claimed that Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has lost his "mental balance". "The way CM Gehlot speaks, it looks like he has lost his mental balance," Verma said. "It is clear now that those who are accusing the BJP-RSS are themselves responsible for the prevailing situation in the state," he added.

174.title: Indian Army rescues 2 youths stuck atop JCB in the middle of Chenab river in J&K
174.article_body: The Indian Army carried out a rescue operation and saved the lives two youths, who were trapped in the middle of the fast-flowing Chenab river in Jammu and Kashmir's  Kishtwar. The duo got stuck in the river current while attempting to cross it in their JCB earth mover. In a video footage, soldiers were purportedly seen rappelling across the river.

175.title: 'The Day After Tomorrow' actor Kenneth Welsh passes away at 80
175.article_body: Canadian actor Kenneth Welsh, best known for his roles in 'Fantastic 4: Rise of the Silver Surfer', 'The Day After Tomorrow' and 'The Aviator', has passed away at the age of 80. While the cause of death hasn't been revealed, his agent Pam Winter said that he died peacefully on May 5 at his home, surrounded by loved ones.

176.title: Evil has returned to Ukraine: Zelenskyy on World War II anniversary
176.article_body: During an address to mark a World War II anniversary on Sunday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that evil has returned to Ukraine. "In a different form, under different slogans, but for the same purpose," he added. On May 8, Europe commemorates the formal surrender of Germany to the Allies in World War II.

177.title: 4 killed after car hits motorbike in Tamil Nadu's Rameswaram
