177.article_body: Four people were killed after a speeding car collided with a motorbike in Tamil Nadu’s Rameswaram district. In the incident, which occurred at 5:30 am on Sunday, all three men on the bike died while the car passengers did not sustain any serious injury, police said. Notably, a pedestrian on the highway also died in the accident.

178.title: Saudi King Salman hospitalised in Jeddah for medical tests
178.article_body: Saudi Arabia's King Salman bin Abdulaziz was admitted to a hospital in Jeddah to undergo medical tests, local media reported on Sunday. The 86-year-old monarch underwent gallbladder surgery in 2020 and reportedly had the battery of his heart pacemaker replaced in March of this year. Abdulaziz took over as Saudi Arabia's King in 2015.

179.title: Ranbir's baraat went from 5th to 7th floor, we danced in the passage: Neetu
179.article_body: Neetu Kapoor in a recent interview spoke about Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding, which took place at the Vastu building in Mumbai. "The best part was baraat, which went from 5th to...7th floor. In the passage we were dancing to bhangra," Neetu said, adding, "I wanted...full ghodi ritual, but then....we thought...[paparazzi] would come and it'd become a crazy thing."

180.title: UP policeman dies in accident hours after taking injured man to hospital
180.article_body: A police constable in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki died after his bike hit stray cattle, hours after he rushed a man injured in a fight at an eatery to a hospital. The 25-year-old man succumbed to the injuries at the hospital. The police constable died when he was returning from the hospital along with a colleague.

181.title: Kohli's frustrated reaction after golden duck goes viral, Bangar seen consoling him
181.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli's frustrated reaction after getting out for a golden duck on the first ball of their IPL 2022 match against SRH has gone viral. Several overs after his dismissal, Kohli was seen putting his hand on head. He was also seen hitting a table in frustration. Later, RCB head coach Sanjay Bangar was seen consoling Kohli.

182.title: 2 ancient Swastikas found on Gyanvapi mosque wall by survey team: Reports
182.article_body: Two ancient Swastikas (sacred Hindu symbol) have been found on the outer wall of the Gyanvapi mosque next to Kashi-Vishwanath temple in UP's Varanasi, reports said quoting a court-appointed survey team member. The videographer reportedly said the faded but legible symbols were found beside lotus flowers on the mosque wall. The survey was halted on Saturday by protesters.

183.title: Centre releases revenue deficit grant of ₹7,183 cr to 14 states
183.article_body: The Centre on Friday released ₹7,183 crore as Post Devolution Revenue Deficit (PDRD) grant to 14 states, including West Bengal, Andhra Pradesh, Rajasthan and Punjab. This was the second monthly instalment of the PDRD grant. With this, the amount released in FY23 stands at ₹14,367 crore. The Fifteenth Finance Commission has recommended a total grant of ₹86,201 crore for FY23.

184.title: No matter what I do, people will always think my mom is better: Palak on Shweta
184.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari's daughter Palak Tiwari said being a star kid comes with the pressure of living up to what their parents have created. "No matter what I do, people will always think...my mom is better...That's something...I've never refuted in my life," she added. "For me to grow where she is, it'll take me a lot of time," Palak said.

185.title: Lord Ram doesn’t bless those with fake emotions: Sanjay Raut
185.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Sunday criticised MNS chief Raj Thackeray over his upcoming visit to Ayodhya, saying that Lord Ram does not bless those coming to him with fake emotions and for political reasons. "Aaditya Thackeray has been invited by different sections of society to highlight the true essence of Hindutva," Shiv Sena's chief spokesperson said.

186.title: Development of pacers has improved India's overseas reputation: Ian Chappell
186.article_body: Former Australia captain Ian Chappell has said the development of fast bowlers like Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammad Shami and Mohammed Siraj has been instrumental in improving India's overseas reputation. "India's enormous depth in pace bowling is the envy of most countries...Team India has evolved...[to a team] that is extremely difficult to beat under any conditions," he added.

187.title: 2 Palestinians who killed 3 civilians using axes arrested: Israel
187.article_body: Israeli security forces on Sunday said that the two Palestinians who killed three civilians in the Elad city have been arrested. The attackers had allegedly used axes to hack the victims on the country's Independence Day. They were caught by the forces in a forest near Elad. The duo appeared to be unhurt in pictures that surfaced following their arrest.

188.title: Tata Projects shortlisted for Noida airport construction
188.article_body: Tata Projects has been shortlisted to construct the terminal, runway and various other airside and landside facilities at the Noida International Airport in Jewar. As per reports, Tata Projects scored higher than other bidders, Larsen & Toubro and Shapoorji Pallonji Group, under the quality and cost-based selection criteria. It might reportedly get the contract after two-three weeks.

189.title: 19 policemen hurt, 12 vehicles damaged in mob attack at Maha steel factory; 27 held
189.article_body: Nineteen policemen sustained injuries and 12 of their vehicles were damaged when they tried to control an attack on a steel factory's employees by over 100 members of a labour union in Maharashtra's Palghar. So far 27 people have been arrested over the incident that took place on Saturday. The situation is tense, but under control, a police spokesperson said.

190.title: When I was expecting, people said 'This will end your career': Malaika
190.article_body: Malaika Arora, speaking to Humans of Bombay, recalled her pregnancy and revealed that when she was expecting Arhaan, people said her career would come to an end. "Back then, after marriage, you'd barely see an actress on screen," she said, adding, "Two months after delivery...I performed at an award show...In fact, I said yes...for 'Kaal Dhamaal' a year after delivery!"

191.title: Thank you for all the love: Sanjay as his debut film Rocky completes 41 yrs
191.article_body: Sanjay Dutt took to Instagram to share a photo from his debut film, 'Rocky', and celebrated 41 years of being in Bollywood. Alongside the post, he wrote, "Four decades + one year is sure a lifetime of a journey! Thank you for all the love you all gave me as 'Rocky'...I hope to keep entertaining all my fans and well-wishers."

192.title: Facebook to drop Nearby Friends, other location-based features
192.article_body: Facebook has started notifying its users that its Nearby Friends, weather alerts, location history and other location-based features won't be available after May 31, 9to5Mac reported. All user information related to these features will reportedly be deleted from Facebook's servers. Users can download their background location data and location history till August 1, the report added.

193.title: Devotees’ footfall is more than capacity in Char Dham Yatra: U’khand CM
193.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Sunday said that devotees’ footfall in Char Dham Yatra, which is resuming after two years, is more than expected. "We are making all possible arrangements but people are more than the capacity at all the four dhams," Dhami added. "We request devotees to make lodging and other arrangements prior to their arrival," Dhami stated.

194.title: Johnny Depp gets gifts, cards from fans outside court amid trial
194.article_body: A video going viral on social media shows actor Johnny Depp being showered with gifts, cards and bouquets by fans as he waves to them while exiting the court in his car amid his ongoing defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard. The video also shows Amber's car exiting the court in silence until a fan of Johnny says, "Lying narcissist."

195.title: Putin busy with Ukraine, Finland & Sweden can join now: NATO ex-chief
195.article_body: Former NATO chief Anders Fogh Rasmussen has said that Finland and Sweden can join the group "exactly now as Russian President Vladimir Putin is preoccupied in Ukraine". "He [Putin] can't do anything about it," he added. He further said that the two countries would be exposed to Russian intimidation and threats if they don't become NATO members now.

196.title: Mumbai-based electronics firm loses ₹7 lakh in cyber fraud
196.article_body: A Mumbai-based electronics firm was duped of ₹7 lakh through email spoofing, according to a police complaint. In an email sent by the accused, an accountant of the company was asked to pay the amount to a Gujarat-based supplier. The fraud was discovered after the supplier informed the firm that no payment has been received.

197.title: Kajal edits Mother's Day post after writer accuses her of copying her poem
197.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal edited her Mother's Day post on Instagram after she was called out by a writer for copying her poem. Kajal has now given credits to the writer and turned off the comments on the post. The writer had claimed that Kajal's post featured an original poem by her and even the caption was copied from her.

198.title: First Made-In-India semi high-speed train set handed over to NCRTC
198.article_body: The first Made-In-India semi high-speed train set for the Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) was handed over to the National Capital Region Transport Corporation (NCRTC) on Saturday, Alstom tweeted. The train has been designed and developed in India by Alstom's local arm. The train is expected to reduce travel time between Delhi and Meerut by 40%, a press release noted.

199.title: Dreaming of becoming Jinnah: BJP on Owaisi's Gyanvapi mosque remark
199.article_body: BJP MP Harnath Singh Yadav on Sunday criticised AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and demanded his arrest for his remarks on the Gyanvapi mosque survey, adding that he's dreaming of becoming Jinnah. Yadav said that Owaisi wants to create a rift between Hindus and Muslims in the country, for which a case of sedition should be registered against him.

200.title: 3 dead, several injured as bus falls into gorge in Maharashtra's Raigad
200.article_body: At least three persons died and several others sustained injuries after a bus carrying 35 passengers fell into a gorge in Maharashtra's Raigad district on Sunday. According to preliminary information, the accident took place after the bus plunged around 50-60 feet into the gorge. The passengers were travelling from Thane to attend a function at Shrivardhan village, as per reports.

201.title: 20-yr-old woman found hanging in train's washroom in Maharashtra
201.article_body: A 20-year-old woman was found hanging in the washroom of an express train at a station in Maharashtra on Sunday. A man and a child who accompanied the woman have been absconding. The incident took place on the Swaraj Express train, which runs from Bandra Terminus in Mumbai to Jammu and Kashmir's Katra.

202.title: 5 people arrested in gaming racket in Hyderabad; cash seized
202.article_body: Hyderabad's Madgul Police along with a special operations team (SOT) under Rachakonda Commissionerate busted a gaming racket on Saturday. Reacting to a tip-off, police raided a gaming area in Bramhan pally and arrested five persons in connection with the crime. Police also seized ₹22,065 and two mobile phones from the accused.

203.title: 3 men held for beating gurudwara manager to death in Punjab
203.article_body: Three men were arrested for beating to death Gurudwara Shri Nabha Sahib's manager in Zirakpur on shrine's premises over an argument. According to the complaint, one of the accused had been living in a room on the gurudwara premises. He also opened an office in it along with another accused, following which the manager asked them to vacate the room.

204.title: 19-year-old Carlos 1st player to beat Nadal, Djokovic in same clay court event
204.article_body: Spain's 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz has become the first player ever to beat both Novak Djokovic and Rafael Nadal in the same clay court tournament. Alcaraz defeated world number one Novak Djokovic 6-7 (5-7), 7-5, 7-6 (7-5) to reach the Madrid Open final. He had earlier defeated Nadal 6-2, 1-6, 6-3 in the quarter-final of the tournament.

205.title: Joe Root will bat at number 4 in Test matches: Ben Stokes
205.article_body: England's newly-appointed Test captain Ben Stokes has said that former skipper Joe Root will bat at number four in England's Test matches. "I've already spoken with Joe. I've asked him to go back to four and I'm going to be at six," Stokes said. "Joe will probably be averaging 90 now instead of 60 so it'll be good," Stokes added.

206.title: Bhubaneswar to host Indian Grand Prix 3 and 4 this month
206.article_body: Bhubaneswar will be hosting the Indian Grand Prix 3 and 4 on May 21 and 24 respectively. The events will be hosted by the Odisha government in collaboration with the Athletics Federation of India and the Odisha Athletics Association. A total of 17 events will be held in the two competitions. Notably, Madurai was previously the designated venue.

207.title: 19-yr-old dies by suicide after being raped by her father in UP
207.article_body: UP's Banda Police on Saturday arrested a 49-year-old labourer for allegedly sexually assaulting his 19-year-old daughter, after which she allegedly died by suicide. The woman's younger sister told the police that their father on Wednesday evening came home in a drunken state and allegedly raped her elder sister, adding that she was depressed and took the extreme step on Thursday.

208.title: Nora gifts dancing gears to underprivileged contestants on her dance show
208.article_body: Actress Nora Fatehi gifted dancing gears to a group of aspiring underprivileged dancers on a dance-based reality show. It included athleisure wear, and shoes, in addition, she also created a fund to support their education. The female dancers hailed from a small town in Madhya Pradesh. While interacting with the girls, Nora learnt about the background of these dancers.

209.title: Aaditya Thackeray to visit Ayodhya on non-political visit on June 10: Raut
209.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray will visit Ayodhya in Uttar Pradesh on June 10 along with Shiv Sena workers from across the country and will seek blessings there, party leader Sanjay Raut said. "Preparations for welcoming Shiv Sena have started in Ayodhya," Raut added. "It's not at all political," Raut stated.

210.title: Delhi Police's complicity in Jahangirpuri violence must be probed: Court
210.article_body: A Delhi court said there was an "utter failure" on the part of the Delhi Police in stopping a Hanuman Jayanti procession held without permission at Jahangirpuri last month. Police personnel "accompanied the illegal procession" and their complicity, "if any", needs to be investigated, the court said in an order. Issue "seems to have been simply brushed aside", it added.

211.title: Deepika said same thing about 'Jayeshbhai...' trailer & '83': Ranveer
211.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has revealed wife Deepika Padukone is "brutally honest" and "always tells it like it is". He added that she said the same thing after watching '83' and 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' trailer. "She was like, 'What you're doing is quite unprecedented, because you are bonafide mainstream, yet you are able to, time after time, create distinctive characters'," Ranveer said.

212.title: I feel your love every day: Janhvi remembers Sridevi on Mother's Day
212.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor took to Instagram on Sunday to share a post remembering her late mother and actress Sridevi on the occasion of Mother's Day. Sharing an old picture of herself with Sridevi, Janhvi wrote, "Even in your absence, I feel your love every day. Even in your absence, you're the best mother in the world. Love you."

213.title: Odisha woman and son lose money after betting on IPL matches, die by suicide
213.article_body: A 55-year-old woman and her 22-year-old son died by suicide in Odisha after losing money by betting on IPL matches. Police said the woman had borrowed money to get her daughter married four years ago and was under pressure from lenders to repay the money. The deceased's neighbours told police that the woman hadn't had a meal for three days.

214.title: He wanted to say so much, couldn't express: Neetu on Rishi's last interaction
214.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor has revealed that when her husband late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor was on the ventilator, there was no communication. She added that she took an iPad with alphabet and told him to point out what he wanted to say but he couldn't lift his finger. "He wanted to say so much and he couldn't express," Neetu said.

215.title: Big belly was the first thing that came to my mind: Pranitha on pregnancy
215.article_body: Actress Pranitha Subhash, who's expecting her first child with husband Nithin Raju, has said the first thing that came to her mind after the positive pregnancy test was a big belly. "As actors, we're obsessed with our looks...But when you get pregnant, you slowly start to think...there's another human being (growing inside you)...That fact takes over your life," she added.

216.title: 64 school students test +ve for COVID-19 at 2 hostels in Odisha
216.article_body: As many as 64 students from different schools have tested COVID-19 positive at two hostels in Odisha's Rayagada. Following this, the health department has called for the 100% health screening of all boarders in residential schools and the preparation of a school-wise action plan. Odisha reported 71 new cases on Saturday, the highest in about a month and a half.

217.title: We have a lovely bond: Avesh on relationship between LSG's pace unit
217.article_body: LSG pacer Avesh Khan, speaking about the relationship between the team's fast-bowling unit, said, "We four have a lovely bond." LSG's pace unit consists of Avesh, Dushmantha Chameera, Mohsin Khan and Jason Holder. Avesh, who scalped three wickets versus KKR on Saturday, stated Mohsin and Chameera gave LSG a good start in the match which helped reduce pressure on him.

218.title: Who was Anna Jarvis, the founder of Mother's Day?
218.article_body: Anna Jarvis was an American activist who founded Mother's Day in 1908 to honour her mother Ann Reeves Jarvis and all mothers. Ann Reeves spent her life working for causes centred around motherhood including the prevention of child mortality and had a desire for the establishment of such a holiday. Anna managed to fulfil her mother's wish after her death.

219.title: Kohli gets out on 1st ball of the match, records his 3rd golden duck of IPL 2022
219.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli got out for a golden duck on the first delivery of their match against SRH on Sunday. Kohli was caught by Kane Williamson at short midwicket on the bowling of spinner Jagadeesha Suchith. This is the third time that Kohli has been dismissed for a golden duck in IPL 2022.

220.title: RBI rate hike wasn't surprising, its timing was: FM Sitharaman
220.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the recent interest rate hike by the RBI was not surprising for her but its timing was. "It came as a surprise because it came between two monetary policy reviews," she added. For the first time since August 2018, RBI on May 4 raised its key lending rate by 40 basis points to 4.40%.

221.title: KKR's Venkatesh is working hard to come back stronger into squad: McCullum
221.article_body: Talking about Venkatesh Iyer, who was dropped from KKR's last two matches in IPL 2022, head coach Brendon McCullum said the all-rounder is working hard in the nets to make a strong comeback into the squad for the remaining matches. "He's a real talent," he added. Venkatesh has scored 132 runs and has been wicketless from nine matches so far.

222.title: Amount of cricket that is expected of people to play is ridiculous: Stokes
222.article_body: England's newly-appointed Test captain Ben Stokes has said the cricketing schedule needs to be looked at. "It really needs looking at from a workload point of view...I want to play as much as I can for England...but...[it's] not possible," he added. Stokes cited the clash of their three-Test series against NZ and the ODI series against the Netherlands as example.

223.title: List of states with most & least domestic violence against women released
223.article_body: As per the National Family Health Survey-5 report, 29% women (of 18-49 age group) in India faced domestic violence. Accordingly, 44.4% women reported domestic violence in Karnataka, 40% in Bihar, 39.6% in Manipur, 38% in Tamil Nadu and 36.9% in Telangana. Lakshadweep (1.3%), Goa (8.3%), Kerala (9.9%), Sikkim (12%) and Meghalaya (16%) reported the least domestic violence against women.

224.title: If cheap fuel is available, why won't we buy it?: FM on India buying Russian oil
224.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that it made "perfect sense" for India to buy Russian oil if it's being offered at a discounted rate, especially amid inflation. She added, "I think we'll go ahead with what is good for the country. We need cheaper fuel. If it is available, why won't we want to buy it? We will buy it."

225.title: FIR against 2 Mumbai mosques for using loudspeakers for azaan before 6 am
225.article_body: Police have registered cases against functionaries of two mosques in Mumbai for using loudspeakers for the early morning prayers before 6 am. A police constable from Bandra police station complained he had heard the azaan being sounded through a loudspeaker at 5.15 am on Thursday. Another sub-inspector heard the azaan being sounded through a loudspeaker at 5.35 am in Santacruz.

226.title: Raj Police reach news anchor Aman Chopra's UP house to arrest him, find it locked
226.article_body: A team of Rajasthan Police went to UP's Noida to arrest news anchor Aman Chopra over his show on the demolition of a temple in Alwar. The arrest wasn't made as Chopra's house was found locked, Rajasthan Police said, adding that UP Police 'didn't cooperate' with them. Chopra's arrest was stayed by Rajasthan HC in two out of three FIRs.

227.title: Malayalam Mission's Qatar official fired over remark against nurses
227.article_body: Malayalam Mission, an initiative by Kerala government to promote the language, fired its Qatar regional coordinator, Durgadas Sisupalan, over derogatory remarks against nurses. "Under the guise of recruiting nurses…we have come to know that they are being taken [to Gulf countries] for meeting the sexual needs of terrorists," Sisupalan reportedly said at Ananthapuram Hindu Maha Sammelan in Kerala.

228.title: RCB to bat first against SRH, SRH make 2 changes to their playing XI
228.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis won the toss and elected to bat first against SRH in their IPL 2022 clash on Sunday. RCB are fielding an unchanged side, while SRH have made two changes to their playing XI. Sean Abbott and Shreyas Gopal have been replaced by Fazalhaq Farooqi and Jagadeesha Suchith in SRH's playing XI.

229.title: Minority body seeks report over Bagga 'not being allowed to wear turban' during arrest
229.article_body: After BJP's Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga alleged he wasn't allowed to wear a turban when Punjab Police came to arrest him in Delhi, National Commission for Minorities Chairman Iqbal Singh Lalpura has written to Punjab's chief secretary seeking a report "within seven days". Further, the Punjab unit of the BJP alleged that Bagga's father was thrashed during the arrest.

230.title: Anand Mahindra gifts a house to TN's 'Idli Amma' on Mother's Day; shares video
230.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra gifted a house to Tamil Nadu's M Kamalathal on the occasion of Mother's Day. Kamalathal, who is fondly known as 'Idli Amma', has been cooking and selling idlis for ₹1 for the past 30 years. "She's the embodiment of a Mother's virtues...A privilege to be able to support her and her work," Mahindra tweeted, sharing her video.

231.title: Two-day training camp for Haj volunteers being held in Mumbai
231.article_body: The Union Minister of Minority Affairs, Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi, on Saturday inaugurated a two-day training camp for Khadim-ul-Hujjaj (haj volunteers) at the Haj House in Mumbai. Over 400 people, including 12 women, will undergo training at the camp. In a tweet, Naqvi said that 79,237 Indians will go for Haj this year, half of them women.

232.title: Top Infibeam executive R Srikanth, wife murdered by driver in Chennai after US return
232.article_body: R Srikanth, the head of corporate finance at finance company Infibeam, and his wife Anuradha were murdered by their driver Krishna in Mylapore in Chennai on Saturday. Srikanth and Anuradha had just returned to India after visiting their daughter in US. Krishna was arrested from Andhra Pradesh while attempting to escape to Nepal with some looted items in a car.

233.title: Arshdeep has been brilliant: Punjab Kings skipper Mayank Agarwal
233.article_body: Punjab Kings skipper Mayank Agarwal has said that pacer Arshdeep Singh has "been nothing short of brilliant" for their franchise in this year's IPL. "He (Arshdeep) puts his hand up when the team needs it. He has been a leader...and it has been fantastic for us. We have to make the best use of our resources," Agarwal said.

234.title: Dating apps being used by sex offenders to lure people: Hyd Police
234.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police warned on Sunday that sex offenders are using dating applications and social media platforms to lure people into prostitution and human trafficking. Most victims of sex trafficking are from Bangladesh, who are offered fake job offers in metropolitan cities, officials said. Police also shared a helpline number for citizens to report any illegal activities.

235.title: Knew hard length would work against Russell: LSG pacer Avesh Khan
235.article_body: After winning against KKR by 75 runs, LSG pacer Avesh Khan has said that he knew that the "hard length ball" would work against KKR all-rounder Andre Russell. "The attempt was to get Russell out...My aim was to go with the hard lengths even if that goes for six. His wicket was the best of the three," Khan said.

236.title: 8-year-old boy killed by crocodile while bathing in Uttar Pradesh
236.article_body: An eight-year-old boy was killed by a crocodile when the former was having a bath in a pond in a village located in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich district. The deceased had gone with his sister to the pond on Saturday afternoon. However, his body was recovered by the forest department's divers only on Sunday morning, officials said.

237.title: Bride-to-be returning from shopping among 5 killed in accident in U'khand
237.article_body: A 25-year-old woman, who was returning from shopping for her wedding scheduled for May 12, and four others were killed after their car fell into a 250-metre-deep gorge on the Rishikesh-Badrinath highway in Uttarakhand on Sunday. The car was on its way to Chamoli from Rishikesh. The victims included two children aged 12 and 15.

238.title: I get mom guilt; if they miss me, I miss them ten folds more: Neha
238.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia in an interview has stated that her mom guilt is something that she sometimes externalises and sometimes internalises. She added, "I feel like if they miss me, I miss them ten folds more." The actress further said that she and her husband actor Angad Bedi try to do as much for their children as they can.

239.title: Saddened to witness rising violence against doctors: CJI NV Ramana
239.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana on Saturday said that he was "extremely saddened" to witness rising violence against doctors. "Several false cases are being lodged against upright and hardworking doctors…They need a better and more secure working environment," CJI added. "This is where professional medical associations assume great significance," CJI stated.

240.title: NCB raids pharmacy firm in Hyderabad, seizes ₹3.7 crore in cash, one held
240.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) busted a digital pharmacy group, suspected to be involved in a global pharma drug trafficking network, in Hyderabad's Domalguda and seized ₹3.71 crore in cash along with several electronic gadgets. The NCB also arrested a person for allegedly carrying out over one thousand illicit diversions and drug shipments from India to the USA, officials said.

241.title: Chahal would be firm favourite to go to T20 WC: Shaun Pollock
241.article_body: Former South Africa captain Shaun Pollock has said RR spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who's currently the highest wicket-taker in the ongoing IPL season, is a "firm favourite" to be part of India's squad for the T20 World Cup later this year. "Chahal wasn't anywhere near the right form when it came to the last World Cup," added Pollock.

242.title: 50-yr-old Pune man killed in sleep after being mistaken for his son
242.article_body: A 50-year-old man was killed with a sharp weapon at his home by a 19-year-old man who mistook him for his son in the dark in Pune. The victim was asleep and had suffered multiple injuries on his neck, shoulder and back in the attack. The accused had entered his home to kill his son who has a criminal record.

243.title: Delhi youth beaten to death by over 15 people on suspicion of being informer
243.article_body: A 20-year-old youth was allegedly beaten to death in Delhi by a group of over 15 people who suspected he was a police informer. Police said they have arrested five men and apprehended four juveniles. "During Holi, my brother had put colour on a woman friend. The accused objected to this and they got into a fight," deceased's sister said.

244.title: I stepped out with brave front only for my kids: Shilpa Shetty
244.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty has stated that she stepped out with a brave front during "difficult times" only for her children Viaan and Samisha. The actress further said that she wanted to show her son that one must have work ethics even in difficult times. This comes amid her husband Raj Kundra's arrest and bail in the porn films case.

245.title: Congress' Nirmala Gahtori to take on U'khand CM Dhami in bypoll
245.article_body: Congress has fielded senior leader Nirmala Gahtori against Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami in the upcoming Assembly bypoll for Champawat seat. The voting will take place on May 31 and the result will be declared on June 3. The bypoll was necessitated after former BJP MLA Kailash Chandra Gahtori vacated the seat for Dhami, who had lost election from Khatima.

246.title: We don't need to  acquire new assets to grow: Tata Steel MD
246.article_body: Tata Steel MD and CEO TV Narendran said the firm will look to grow organically and doesn't "really need to acquire new assets to grow [output]". "We will rely more on organic growth during this decade," Narendran said. "Right now, costs are stable, so steel prices are stable. We are comfortable with that," he added.

247.title: I was supposed to be India captain, then the Greg Chappell incident happened: Yuvraj
247.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh has revealed he was supposed to become India captain, but couldn't due to the Greg Chappell incident. "It had become Chappell or Sachin Tendulkar. I was probably the only player who supported...my teammate. Some...BCCI officials didn't like it," Yuvraj added. He stated, "It was said that they should make anybody the captain but not myself."

248.title: Local UK election result decided on coin toss as both candidates get equal votes
248.article_body: The result of a local election in the UK was decided by the toss of a coin after both the candidates received the exact number of votes. A video of this also surfaced on social media. The vote for Llanfoist Fawr and Govilon counties was decided with a toss with the result coming in favour of Tory candidate Tomos Davies.

249.title: Watched Oye Lucky! Lucky Oye! to prepare for my role in 'Band...': Ranveer
249.article_body: Recalling the time when he auditioned for his debut film 'Band Baaja Baaraat', actor Ranveer Singh said, "I gave the audition for 'Band Baaja Baaraat,' and I was told that the role is of a 21-year-old boy from Delhi." "I worked on my accent by watching all the Delhi based films...such as Dibakar Banerjee's 'Oye Lucky! Lucky Oye!'," he added.

250.title: Ukrainian drone destroys Russian ship near Snake Island in Black Sea; video released
250.article_body: Ukraine on Saturday said it has destroyed another Russian ship near Snake Island in the Black Sea. Ukraine's Defence Ministry said an armed drone destroyed a Serna-class landing craft. "The traditional parade of the Russian Black Sea fleet on May 9 this year will be held near Snake Island - at the bottom of the sea," Ukraine's Defence Ministry tweeted.

251.title: Gyanvapi mosque survey stopped as protesters deny entry to court-appointed team
251.article_body: The survey of the Gyanvapi mosque near Kashi Vishwanath temple in UP was halted on Saturday after some protesters denied entry to the Advocate Commissioner Ajai Kumar and other court-appointed lawyers. Kumar said, "Some Muslims gathered at the entrance and didn't let us enter." Anjuman Intezamia Masjid Committee (Gyanvapi) filed a court petition seeking Kumar's replacement, accusing him of 'bias'.

252.title: Musk to launch new Twitter product, expects 104 million users by 2028: NYT
252.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk, who's acquiring Twitter for $44 billion, plans to launch a new Twitter product called "X", according to his investor presentation obtained by The New York Times. Musk expects to launch the product in 2023 and estimates it would have nine million subscribers in its first year and 104 million subscribers by 2028, the NYT reported.

253.title: People coming from different beliefs can work together: Munawar on Kangana
253.article_body: Munawar Faruqui, who won 'Lock Upp', spoke about working with Kangana Ranaut, who hosted the show. "That's the beauty of...a democratic country...You may come from different beliefs but you can always work together," he said, adding, "Many...raised questions about me doing this show...But I knew it was a means to connect with fans...and I was successful in doing that."

254.title: Delhi Capitals forced into isolation after net bowler tests COVID-19 positive: Reports
254.article_body: The Delhi Capitals (DC) contingent has been forced into isolation after a net bowler tested positive for COVID-19. This comes just hours before DC were scheduled to face CSK in their 11th IPL 2022 match in Mumbai. Earlier in the season, six members of the DC contingent had tested positive for the virus.

255.title: Best investment you'll make: Poonawalla suggests Musk to make Tesla cars in India
255.article_body: The Serum Institute of India's Adar Poonawalla on Sunday suggested Tesla CEO Elon Musk to invest in India by manufacturing Tesla cars in the country. Poonawalla wrote, "Just in case you don't end up buying Twitter, do look at investing...in India for high-quality large-scale manufacturing of Tesla cars. I assure you this will be the best investment you'll ever make."

256.title: Shehnaaz Gill dances with Brahma Kumaris on Punjabi folk song, video surfaces
256.article_body: A video of Shehnaaz Gill dancing with Brahma Kumaris on a Punjabi folk song at an event in Delhi has surfaced online. The actress, who was invited to launch the Empowerment of Girl Child campaign, also delivered a speech on girl empowerment. "Stop calling girls soft, delicate, innocent. We are not helpless at all," Shehnaaz said at the event.

257.title: AAP demands Himachal govt’s resignation after Khalistan flags incident
257.article_body: After Khalistan flags were seen tied to the main gate of Himachal Pradesh’s Vidhan Sabha building in Dharamshala, AAP said nothing can be more "shameful" than this. "Your government has no right to continue in power, the entire government should resign immediately," AAP Himachal Pradesh tweeted. "Jairam Thakurji, your government allowed this incident despite heavy security," AAP added.

258.title: Raashii Khanna gifts her mom a BMW 740li worth over ₹1.40 cr, pics surfaces
258.article_body: Actress Raashii Khanna gifted her mother a premium BMW 740li worth over ₹1.40 cr on the occasion of Mother's Day. She opted for a classic blue metallic colour, which has coordinated interiors in dark brown colour. In the picture that has surfaced online, Raashii, along with her parents can be seen posing with the new car.

259.title: My beautiful mothers: Alia shares pic with Soni and Neetu on Mother's Day
259.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt wished Mother's Day to her mother, Soni Razdan, and mother-in-law, Neetu Kapoor. The actress shared an unseen picture from her and her husband Ranbir Kapoor's wedding reception in which she posed with her two mothers. She captioned the photo, "My beautiful beautiful mothers. Happy Mother's Day. All day every day!"

260.title: Kajal Aggarwal copies poem, caption from Instagram user for Mother's Day, gets called out
260.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal has been called out for copying an Instagram user's poem and caption for her post on Mother's Day. "My Dear Mum poem passed off as original work by Kajal Aggarwal," writer Sarah wrote on Instagram. "The weird copy of my original caption with...a few words swapped out makes me think it isn't an honest mistake," she added.

261.title: Kane needs to turn from William to Villain and attack with bat: Shoaib Akhtar
261.article_body: Ahead of SRH's game against RCB, ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said SRH captain Kane Williamson, who has so far scored 199 runs in 10 games at a strike rate of 96.14 in IPL 2022, needs to show aggression with the bat. "Kane needs to turn from William to villain...He needs to score, otherwise SRH (will be in trouble)," added Akhtar.

262.title: Comedian Munawar Faruqui wins Lock Upp season 1, gets ₹20-lakh cash prize
262.article_body: Comedian Munawar Faruqui has won the first season of reality show 'Lock Upp', while Payal Rohatgi finished as runner-up of the show hosted by Kangana Ranaut. Munawar has been awarded a cash prize of ₹20 lakh, a brand-new car and a trip to Italy for winning the show. The show's grand finale took place on May 7.

263.title: Khalistan flags put up at Himachal Pradesh Assembly in Dharamshala
263.article_body: Khalistan flags were found tied to the main gate and boundary wall of the Himachal Pradesh Legislative Assembly in Dharamshala on Sunday morning. "It could be an act of some tourists from Punjab. We're going to register a case today," SP Kangra Kushal Sharma said. State CM Jairam Thakur condemned the "cowardly act" and said it will not be "tolerated".

264.title: Rahul says 2 LPG cylinders in 2014 are worth 'price of 1 now'
264.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday compared the price of LPG cylinders under the Congress in 2014 and under BJP in 2022, saying, "Two cylinders then for the price of one now." He claimed that in 2014, LPG cylinder was worth ₹410, while in 2022 it's worth ₹999. "Only Congress governs for...welfare of poor and middle-class Indian families," he said.

265.title: Ukraine war affecting China's calculations on Taiwan: US spy chief
265.article_body: US Central Intelligence Agency chief William Burns on Saturday claimed that Ukraine war has affected China's calculations on gaining control over Taiwan. He said that Chinese President Xi Jinping is looking "carefully at what lessons to draw" for Taiwan. He also claimed that Jinping is "unsettled" by the reputational damage that can come from association with Russia's "brutishness" in Ukraine.

266.title: Yashasvi must have thought 'How did I lose my place in the XI': Sehwag
266.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said RR's Yashasvi Jaiswal must have been hurt after getting dropped from the playing XI after playing three matches in IPL 2022. "He must have [thought], 'How did I lose my place? I was retained but someone else is playing'. When a player is hurt, expect him to do well when he comes back," stated Sehwag.

267.title: Doesn't make any sense: Tejashwi on Kishor's remark of 'no development'
267.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has said that poll strategist Prashant Kishor's statement of "no development" in Bihar for the past 30 years is "baseless". "Kishor's statement does not make any sense. I am not aware of his whereabouts...who is he? He has never been a factor in anything so far," Yadav said.

268.title: 22-year-old man arrested over 9 armed robberies in Pune in 2 days
268.article_body: A 22-year-old man was arrested on Saturday while his associate is absconding for allegedly being involved in nine armed robberies that took place in parts of Pune in two days. The duo, who roamed on a two-wheeler, had injured a few people and escaped with mobiles, wallets, cash and gold chains. The arrested accused was previously booked in other cases.

269.title: Bengaluru to face water supply disruption for 18 hrs tomorrow
269.article_body: Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board (BWSSB) has announced that parts of the city will face water supply disruption tomorrow for 18 hours. The water supply will be affected between 3 am and 9 pm. The board said that this was due to the emergency shutdown of Cauvery water supply treatment plant and pumping stations at TK Halli and Tataguni.

270.title: Kajal Aggarwal shares first glimpse of son on Mother's Day, pens note
270.article_body: Kajal Aggarwal, who welcomed her first son with Gautam Kitchlu in April, shared the first glimpse of her son on Sunday on the occasion of Mother's Day. She also penned a note wherein she wrote, "I want you to know how precious you are and always will be to me." "You've taught me what it is to be...mother," Kajal added.

271.title: Galwan valley martyr's wife becomes Lieutenant, says 'It was my husband's dream'
271.article_body: Rekha Singh, the wife of Lance Naik and Vir Chakra awardee Deepak Singh has become a Lieutenant in the Indian Army. Deepak Singh was martyred during a clash with the Chinese People's Liberation Army in Galwan valley. "It was my husband's dream that pushed me to strive hard to make it to the Indian Army," said Lieutenant Rekha Singh.

272.title: 22-year-old woman hit by truck in Mumbai, dies
272.article_body: A woman (22) died and another woman (26) was injured after a dumper truck hit them in the Shivaji Nagar locality of Mumbai's Govandi area. The deceased, identified as Arshiya Khan, was riding pillion with her associate on a scooty when the incident took place, police said. Notably, the accused was held and booked under IPC's Section 304-A.

273.title: 2 killed, 60 feared dead as Russia bombs Ukraine school: Governor
273.article_body: At least two people were killed and 60 others, trapped under debris, are feared dead after Russian forces bombed a school in Ukrainian village of Bilohorivka, said Governor of the Luhansk region on Sunday. As many as 90 people were sheltering in the school that was engulfed by fire, out of which 30 have been rescued, he said.

274.title: Badrinath Dham shrine opens for devotees today
274.article_body: The portals of Badrinath Dham opened for devotees on Sunday morning with rituals and chanting and the tunes of Army band. The temple has been decorated with flowers and lights. The shrine is one of the four ancient pilgrimage sites referred to as 'Char Dham' which also includes Yamunotri, Gangotri and Kedarnath.

275.title: Man banged my car, gave rape threats, his wife also got aggressive: TV actress Mahhi Vij
275.article_body: TV actress Mahhi Vij took to Twitter to take Mumbai Police's help, claiming that a man banged her car and got abusive. Sharing a video showing the number plate of the man's vehicle, Mahhi wrote, "[He] gave me rape threats. His wife got [also] got aggressive. @MumbaiPolice, help me find this guy who is threat to us."

276.title: Vicky shares pics with mom Veena & mom-in-law Suzanne Turquotte on Mother's Day
276.article_body: Vicky Kaushal shared pictures with his mother, Veena Kaushal, and mother-in-law, Suzanne Turquotte, on Mother's Day. The pictures were from his wedding with Katrina Kaif, which took place in December. In the first photo, Vicky can be seen dancing with his mother in his Baraat. He also shared a picture with Katrina's mother, wherein he is seen taking her blessings.

277.title: China-backed John Lee becomes Hong Kong's new leader
277.article_body: John Lee, who is said to be backed by the Chinese regime, was elected as the new leader of Hong Kong on Sunday. He would replace the incumbent leader, Carrie Lam, as the Chief Executive on July 1. Lee, who was the lone candidate in the election, secured 1,416 votes, comfortably surpassing the 751-mark needed to win.

278.title: Putin believes he can't afford to lose: US spy chief on Ukraine war
278.article_body: US Central Intelligence Agency Director William Burns said on Saturday that Russian President Vladimir Putin "doesn't believe he can afford to lose" in Ukraine and so "stakes are high" in the war. He added that Putin had been "stewing" over Ukraine for years. "I think [Putin's] convinced right now that doubling down...will enable him to make progress," he further said.

279.title: Still can't think of any game where we had a complete performance: Rahul
279.article_body: After their eighth win in 11 games in IPL 2022, LSG captain KL Rahul said he still can't think of a game this season where they had a "complete performance". He added, "I don't think any team is going to be perfect...[but] still [there are] areas to improve." Currently, LSG are at the top of the IPL points table.

280.title: I've some weird fascination with number 8, I like the way it looks: Ranbir
280.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, who's in Dubai to attend Celebrity Football Cup 2022, said during a press conference that he has "some weird fascination" with the number 8. "It is my mother's (Neetu Kapoor) birthday, 8th July, and I also like the whole way the number looks, because it is the infinity sign if you look at it horizontally," he added.

281.title: Disha Patani joins the cast of Prabhas & Deepika starrer 'Project K'
281.article_body: Disha Patani has joined the cast of Prabhas and Deepika Padukone-starrer 'Project K'. Taking to her Instagram Story, Disha shared a snapshot of a welcome gift basket that she received from Vyjayanthi Movies. The welcome note read, "Project K welcomes you! We are thrilled to have you on board!" The gift basket included a bunch of red and pink roses.

282.title: Karan Johar starts shooting for Koffee with Karan Season 7
282.article_body: Karan Johar has started shooting for the seventh season of his talk show, 'Koffee with Karan'. Taking to Instagram Stories, he shared a picture of Koffee with Karan mug, writing, "And so it begins." According to reports, the first episode will be shot with Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt, who'll be seen in Karan's 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'.

283.title: Heavy rainfall warning issued for Odisha, Andhra, Bengal due to Cyclone Asani
283.article_body: The deep depression over southeast Bay of Bengal moved west northwestwards with a speed of 16 kmph during past 6 hours and intensified into a cyclonic storm 'Asani', the IMD said on Sunday. Cyclone Asani could bring light to moderate rain with heavy rain in isolated areas in Odisha, West Bengal and Andhra Pradesh from Tuesday, the IMD added.

284.title: Andhra Sub-Inspector held for abetting 21-yr-old woman’s suicide
284.article_body: A police Sub-Inspector (SI) from Andhra Pradesh was arrested for allegedly abetting a 21-year-old woman's suicide. He purportedly cheated the woman in the name of love. "The woman consumed pesticide two days ago after she learnt that the SI recently married another woman," police said. She succumbed while undergoing treatment in a hospital on Friday.

285.title: 52-yr-old Kami Rita Sherpa scales Mt Everest for 26th time, breaks his own world record
285.article_body: Nepalese mountaineer Kami Rita Sherpa has scaled Mount Everest for 26th time, breaking his own world record of 25 ascents set last year. The 52-year-old had scaled Mount Everest for the first time on May 13, 1994. Kami Rita holds the record for climbing peaks above 8,000 metres the maximum number of times.

286.title: Shooters fire over 10 rounds at a car on busy Delhi road, video surfaces
286.article_body: Some armed men fired over 10 rounds at a car on a busy road in Delhi's Subhash Nagar area on Saturday night. An ex-chairman of a local mandi and his brother have been injured in the incident and are said to be in a critical condition. A CCTV footage of the incident has surfaced online. Police are investigating the matter.

287.title: Kejriwal is scared of him: Bagga’s father after midnight court hearing
287.article_body: Soon after BJP’s Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga was released from Punjab Police custody in Haryana, his father, Preetpal Singh Bagga, said AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal is "scared" of his son. "Arvind Kejriwal is scared of him as he's exposing his wrongdoings," Preetpal said. Tajinder was granted relief by Punjab and Haryana High Court, which held an urgent hearing at midnight.

288.title: Alarmed: UN chief on Taliban making face cover must for women
288.article_body: UN Secretary-General António Guterres on Sunday said that he's "alarmed" over Taliban's decree which makes face covering a requirement for Afghan women in public and asks them to not leave their homes unless necessary. "I...urge Taliban to keep their promises to Afghan women," he added. Male guardians will be punished if women don't cover their faces, the decree also states.

289.title: Only those who pay Krushna & my bills can question us: Kashmera Shah
289.article_body: When asked if she and Krushna faced any opposition when they were planning to get married, actress Kashmera Shah said, "Only those who pay Krushna and my bills can question us." "Those who are seething with anger that we are successful, married, have kids and are happy can go suck their thumbs," she added.

290.title: Man stabbed to death over an argument in UP's Jaunpur, 3 held
290.article_body: A man was stabbed to death and another injured over an argument at the Gaura Badshahpur area in Jaunpur, Uttar Pradesh. Three people have been arrested for the alleged murder while four people have been arrested for allegedly protesting against the murder in which the Jaunpur-Azamgarh highway was blocked as well. The deceased is identified as Badal Yadav (22).

291.title: Mumbai's Sion Flyover to remain closed every weekend till June 20
291.article_body: The Sion Flyover in Mumbai will remain closed for vehicular traffic every weekend till June 20. The decision has been taken to enable the Maharashtra State Road Development Corporation to carry out the repair work. Alternative routes have been formed by the traffic police which will be implemented from 5 pm on Friday till 6 am on Monday.

292.title: Nothing is well-settled in KKR, they are looking insecure: Jaffer
292.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said "nothing is well-settled" in KKR and there are insecurities in the team which are reflected in their performance in the ongoing IPL season. "You can look at their top-order and the death bowling as well...they have not found the right combination," he added. KKR have lost seven of their 11 games so far.

293.title: Protests held in US cities in support of abortion rights
293.article_body: Hundreds of people took out rallies in support of abortion rights in multiple cities across the US, including Chicago, Atlanta and Houston, on Saturday. This comes after a leaked Supreme Court draft opinion reportedly suggested overturning a landmark ruling that legalised abortion. In Atlanta, the protesters chanted, "Not the church and not the state, women must decide our fate."

294.title: Venkatesh didn't get runs, we were forced to look for other options: McCullum
294.article_body: Opening up on dropping all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer from the playing XI after nine games, KKR head coach Brendon McCullum said they were forced to look for other options as the 27-year-old didn't get runs. "He's working hard [in] the nets, trying to get his form back...He's certainly not out of contention for the games to come," added McCullum.

295.title: Pro-Russia parade likely in Germany on May 9 Victory Day: Intel
295.article_body: The German intelligence said it expects pro-Russia parades and demonstrations on May 9 on the occasion of Victory Day. The day marks Soviet army's win over Nazi Germany. "Pro-Russian activities such as car parades and demonstrations are to be expected all over Germany, possibly also showing the 'Z' symbol of the Russian army invading Ukraine," said the intelligence chief.

296.title: Shimron Hetmyer leaves RR bio-bubble, to return after birth of first child
296.article_body: RR batter Shimron Hetmyer has left the RR bio-bubble and has travelled back to Guyana for the imminent birth of his first child. "Babies are born only once and this will be my first...It's only because of a special emergency that I'm leaving," Hetmyer said in a video shared by RR. He'll return following the birth of his first child.

297.title: Police serving political masters can break up federalism: Chidambaram
297.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Saturday said police serving their respective "political masters" will lead to the ultimate breakdown of federalism that is already in peril. Chidambaram was reacting to the arrest of BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga by the Punjab Police. "The 'autonomy' of each state police force must stop at the border of another state," Chidambaram tweeted.

298.title: Pak drone spotted in J&K's Arnia, returns after firing by BSF
298.article_body: BSF opened fire at a drone coming from Pakistan side that crossed the International Border at Jammu and Kashmir's Arnia on Saturday. The drone had "hardly" crossed the border when eight rounds were fired at it, following which it returned to Pakistan side, a BSF officer said. A search operation was conducted and nothing suspicious was found, the officer added.

299.title: If a girl asks for condom at the chemist, it becomes a talking point: Nushrratt
299.article_body: Speaking about condoms being a taboo issue in our society, actress Nushrratt Bharuccha, who'll be next seen in 'Janhit Mein Jaari', said, "If a girl asks for a condom at the chemist...it becomes a talking point." "We were shooting in Chanderi and if I had gone and asked for a condom, the whole town would've come to know!" he added.

300.title: 3 children among 5 of family drown in quarry in Maharashtra's Thane district
300.article_body: Five members of a family, including three children, drowned in a water-filled quarry in Thane district. Police said a child slipped and fell into the water and to save the child, the others also jumped into the water. The deceased were identified as Meera Gaikwad (55), her daughter-in-law Apeksha Gaikwad (30) and grandchildren Mayuresh (14), Moksha (13) and Siddhesh (14).

301.title: I love lassi, I love how it cools palate if you're hot-hit with curry: Benedict
301.article_body: Benedict Cumberbatch in an interview said he loves lassi, adding that he loves how it cools the palate "especially if you're a hot-hit with...curry". The actor, who taught English at a Tibetan monastery in Darjeeling at the age of 19, added, "Tibetan tea I got an odd kind of taste for, which is saying something. It's kind of...buttery and salty."

302.title: Salary pending for 5 months, MCD teachers declare strike
302.article_body: The municipal school teachers' union has announced a strike to be held on Monday over the delay in salary disbursement by Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD). The salaries of many of the teachers are reportedly pending for five months in EDMC. "There is five months of pendency in East MCD and two months in North MCD," said the union chief.

303.title: We knew he was due for a good innings: Samson on Yashasvi's 68(41)
303.article_body: Talking about Yashasvi Jaiswal's 68-run innings against PBKS, RR captain Sanju Samson said they knew the 20-year-old was due for a good innings as he was spending a lot of hours in the nets. "[I'm] very happy for him," added Samson. This was Yashasvi's fourth game and first fifty-plus score in IPL 2022. RR defeated PBKS by six wickets.

304.title: 21-yr-old man held for posing as policeman, extorting money in Mohali
304.article_body: A 21-year-old unemployed man was arrested for posing as a policeman to extort money from commuters at a fake check post in Mohali's Phase 6. "He got the fake uniform stitched through a tailor for ₹4,000 and had been going around in his car, extorting money from unwary people by posing as a cop," a police official said.

305.title: 30% women in 18-49 age bracket in India faced physical violence: NFHS
305.article_body: Nearly one-third of women in India have experienced physical or sexual violence, according to the National Family Health Survey-5 report released by Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya. As per the report, 30% of women between the age of 18 and 49 have experienced physical violence since the age of 15 years, while 6% have experienced sexual violence in their lifetime.

306.title: Munawar Faruqui wins Lock Upp season 1, gets ₹20 lakh cash prize
306.article_body: Stand-up comedian Munawar Faruqui became the first winner of the reality show 'Lock Upp' on Saturday's grand finale episode. Along with the trophy, he won a cash prize of ₹20 lakh, a Maruti Suzuki Ertiga and a fully sponsored trip to Italy. Meanwhile, actress Payal Rohatgi finished as the first runner-up of the Kangana Ranaut-hosted show.

307.title: Yuzvendra Chahal records most wickets by an RR spinner in an IPL season
307.article_body: RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal has set the record for taking the most wickets by an RR spinner in an IPL season. With his three-wicket haul against PBKS, Chahal took his tally of wickets in IPL 2022 to 22. He broke the record held by leg-spinner Shreyas Gopal, who had taken 20 wickets for RR in IPL 2019.

308.title: No coercive action against Tajinder Bagga till May 10: Punjab & Haryana HC at midnight
308.article_body: Hours after a Mohali court issued a non-bailable warrant against him, Delhi BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga was granted relief by Punjab and Haryana High Court, which held an urgent hearing at midnight. "The HC has ordered no coercive action shall be taken against him till the next hearing on May 10," said Bagga's counsel, senior advocate Anil Mehta.

309.title: Everybody has their helplessness: Bobby on not starring in Imtiaz's Jab We Met
309.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol spoke about not being a part of filmmaker Imtiaz Ali's film 'Jab We Met'. He said that earlier, Imtiaz used to be his "very good friend". "Everybody has their helplessness and they take decisions," he added. "Maybe one friend's decision makes the other friend feel bad. It keeps on happening," Bobby said.

310.title: Bomb scare in Delhi’s Vasant Vihar after foreigner leaves bags
310.article_body: Two bags, which according to locals were left unattended by a foreigner, triggered a bomb scare at a market in Delhi's Vasant Vihar on Saturday. The police cordoned off the area and evacuated people in an operation only to find clothes and other items in the bags. "There was no suspicious or illegal item in the two bags," said police.

311.title: Khalistan flags found tied to main gate at Himachal's Vidhan Sabha
311.article_body: Khalistan flags were seen tied to the main gate of Himachal Pradesh's Vidhan Sabha building in Dharamshala on Sunday. Kangra SP Kushal Sharma said that the flags, which have now been removed, could have been put up by "some tourists from Punjab". He added that the act could have taken place early in the morning or late at night.

312.title: In film industry, you can lose work because of miscommunication: Kartik
312.article_body: Speaking about miscommunication in the film industry, actor Kartik Aaryan said, "Many times miscommunication happens in...industry. Not only in this industry, but it also happens in every industry," he said. "Sometimes this can be good for you but sometimes you can lose work because of it. But I believe...the industry is going through a good phase [now]," he added.

313.title: Fire breaks out in a hospital in Hyderabad, no casualties reported
313.article_body: A fire broke out at the Sri Vani Hospital, also known as Old Farhat Hospital, located in the Malakpet area of Hyderabad on Saturday. During the rescue operation by the firefighters, 19 people were rescued from the spot, fire officials said. Notably, no casualties were reported but one of the two buildings of the hospital got gutted in the fire.

314.title: India reports 3,451 new COVID-19 cases, 40 deaths in 24 hours
314.article_body: India has reported 3,451 COVID-19 cases, 3,079 recoveries and 40 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,805 COVID-19 cases and 22 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 20,635, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,064.

315.title: We are not able to capitalise on small things, LSG outplayed us: Shreyas
315.article_body: After their seventh defeat in 11 games in the ongoing IPL season, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said they have not been able to capitalise on small things during their matches. On their 75-run defeat against LSG, Shreyas said, "They outplayed us in both the departments, batting and bowling...we leaked a lot of runs in death overs...They posted a nice total."

316.title: Bengaluru police arrest 3 for cheating people through investments
316.article_body: Bengaluru City DCP (North East Division) Anoop A Shetty tweeted on Saturday that the police have arrested three people from Bellary who used to allegedly cheat people by taking money for investing in share markets. He added that the accused used to offer "high returns" on the investments. Furthermore, he urged people to verify companies before investing.

317.title: People won’t forgive those who’ve robbed J&K of unique status: Farooq
317.article_body: People won’t forgive those who have "robbed" Jammu and Kashmir of its unique status, prized historical individuality and dignity, Farooq Abdullah, National Conference chief, said. "The BJP and its proxies will be punished by the people of J&K," he added. There is anger brewing among people due to the bad policies of the current government, Abdullah stated.

318.title: Greenboards to replace blackboards in Pune Zilla Parishad schools
318.article_body: The Pune Zilla Parishad is set to replace the existing blackboards in schools with green chalkboards. "Under the Guardian Minister School Development scheme, we have decided to replace blackboards with green chalk boards. According to experts, these green boards are better for visibility and help make learning more interactive," Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said.

319.title: How can CSK still qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs?
319.article_body: Defending champions CSK are currently ninth on IPL 2022 points table. CSK would require to win each of their remaining four matches with a big margin to stand a chance to qualify for playoffs with 14 points. CSK would also need results of other matches to go their way, with MI winning each of their remaining matches except against CSK.

320.title: Man whose marriage proposal was rejected caused Indore fire that killed 7: Police
320.article_body: A case has been registered against a 27-year-old man for allegedly causing a fire at a three-storey building in Indore in which seven people were killed and nine injured. Police said Shubham aka Sanjay Dixit allegedly torched the scooter of a woman who rejected his marriage offer. Police added they found a man ignited the blaze after scanning CCTV footage.

321.title: Pune records 33 new COVID-19 infections; active cases at 262
321.article_body: Pune district recorded 33 new COVID-19 cases, while the number of active cases stood at 262, the state health department said on Saturday. Pune rural reported one new case, while the number was 22 in the city and 10 in PCMC. The district has registered a total of around 14.5 lakh cases since the pandemic began.

322.title: Pune public transport service plans to provide Wi-Fi on buses
322.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) board has taken up the plan to provide Wi-Fi services on buses in a bid to increase ridership and explore non-ticketing revenue, the body's Joint Managing Director Chetana Kerure said. She added that this was done following a successful trial last week. PMPML is also planning to add electric boards for advertisements.

323.title: Cong must first enact farm loan waivers in states it rules: KTR
323.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao on Saturday responded to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's 'Warangal declaration', saying the party should first implement the waivers in states it rules. "There's nothing new in the declaration he made yesterday," Rao added. Gandhi has promised ₹2 lakh farm loan waivers and fair and accurate MSP if Congress is elected to power in Telangana.

324.title: Punjab jail officer suspended over fake lemon purchase entries
324.article_body: A jail officer in Punjab has reportedly been suspended for allegedly adding fake entries for purchase of lemons for inmates during last month's price rise. An inquiry was ordered after Kapurthala Modern Jail's inmates claimed they didn't get any lemons despite records showing that about 50 kg of lemons were purchased. The investigation revealed several irregularities, including misuse of funds.

325.title: Will hold talks if Naxals show faith in Constitution: Chhattisgarh CM
325.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel said that the state government is ready to hold discussions with Naxals if they "express faith in the Constitution". Recently, a press release was issued by the Dandakaranya Special Zonal Committee (DKSZC) spokesperson, Vikalp, stating Maoists were ready to hold talks with the government if their demands were fulfilled.

326.title: Sanskrit can take us from darkness to light: JP Nadda
326.article_body: Speaking at an event organised by the Central Sanskrit University (CSU) in Delhi, BJP National President JP Nadda described Sanskrit as a "means of taking us from darkness to light". "We need to preserve Sanskrit because...it is a way to achieve advancements in various dimensions of our society," he said. Sanskrit is a part of India's culture, Nadda added.

327.title: LSG dismiss KKR for their lowest total in IPL 2022, go top of points table
327.article_body: LSG defeated KKR by 75 runs on Saturday to go top of the IPL 2022 points table. LSG have now won four matches in a row. LSG put up a total of 176/7 and dismissed KKR for 101 in 14.3 overs, their lowest total of IPL 2022. KKR have now lost seven of their first 11 matches in the tournament.

328.title: All women, children, elderly evacuated from Mariupol plant: Ukraine
328.article_body: Ukrainian Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk on Saturday announced that all women, children and elderly people have been evacuated from Mariupol's Azovstal steel plant. "This part of the Mariupol humanitarian operation is over," she said. Russian forces launched an attack on the steel plant this week, the last remaining pocket of Ukrainian resistance in the city.

329.title: PBKS' Livingstone stands outside off-stump, RR pacer Prasidh Krishna complains to umpire
329.article_body: During the second-last over of PBKS' innings in their match against RR, fast bowler Prasidh Krishna was seen complaining to the umpire after PBKS' Liam Livingstone was seen standing outside the off-stump. Krishna then bowled the first delivery from round the wicket. The umpire didn't signal it wide despite the ball being wide of the tramline.

330.title: Tajinder Bagga's arrest by Punjab Police was kidnapping: Goa CM
330.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant met BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga in Delhi and called his arrest by the Punjab Police a "kidnapping". He also said that the Punjab Police was being 'used politically' by the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP). "I commend Delhi and Haryana Police, as they stopped him in between and brought him back," Sawant added.

331.title: 6 Tamil Nadu Police personnel arrested for murder in custodial death case
331.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Police's Crime Branch-Crime Investigative Department (CB-CID) has arrested six police personnel on charges of murder in connection with the alleged custodial death of 25-year-old Vignesh. The arrests were made on the basis of the deceased's autopsy report, which indicated 13 injuries on the body. While two policemen were arrested on Friday, four others were arrested on Saturday.

332.title: Work ethic expectations from Twitter employees will be extreme: Elon Musk
332.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk tweeted "work ethic expectations would be extreme" after he completes the $44 billion acquisition of Twitter. He added that expectations from Twitter employees will be "much less than I demand of myself". Musk earlier said Twitter will be "super focussed" on software engineering, design, information security and server hardware after he acquires Twitter.

333.title: I feel I've been reborn: Man who jumped 12 ft to escape burning building in Indore
333.article_body: A 19-year-old who made a 12-foot jump to escape the fire in his building in MP's Indore said, "I feel I have got a rebirth." Tushar Badoliya Prajapati was sleeping on the terrace of a three-storey building that caught on fire leading to the death of seven people, including a couple. Prajapati thought of jumping after realising he was trapped.

334.title: Who is Putin's rumoured girlfriend Alina Kabaeva?
334.article_body: Former Russian gymnast Alina Kabaeva, rumoured to be President Vladimir Putin's girlfriend, could be targeted with EU sanctions. Alina occupies the top position at National Media Group, which has large stakes in almost all major Russian state media outlets. She's an Olympic medal-winning gymnast. There are rumours they have children together. Putin has, however, denied a relationship with her.

335.title: 3 arrested for cow slaughter in MP's Seoni, 19 kg beef seized
335.article_body: Police in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district on Friday arrested three persons who were distributing beef among themselves after allegedly killing a calf. Over 19 kg of beef was recovered from the accused along with weapons such as axes, police said. Four other accused managed to flee from the spot and a search is underway to find them, police added.

336.title: Beijing launches fresh round of mass testing to curb COVID spread
336.article_body: China's capital Beijing has launched a fresh round of mass testing of residents for COVID-19 on Saturday. The local authorities have also banned restaurant dining-in services in multiple districts and shut down more than 60 subway stations in the city in an effort to curb the spread of COVID-19. These restrictions are part of China's 'Zero-COVID' policy.

337.title: Man cremates wife after living with her dead body for 21 years in Thailand
337.article_body: A 72-year-old man in Thailand cremated his wife after living with her dead body in the same room for 21 years. "You're just going for a brief business and you'll be back home again. It won't be long, I promise," he said to his wife's remains before cremation. He revealed he has worked as a medic in Royal Thai Army.

338.title: Ronaldo's girlfriend shares pics of newborn daughter, couple name her Bella Esmeralda
338.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo's girlfriend Georgina Rodríguez took to Instagram to share pictures of their newborn daughter. Georgina revealed that they have named their daughter 'Bella Esmeralda'. She was born on April 18. Ronaldo and Georgina were expecting twins, however, their newborn son passed away. Earlier, Ronaldo had shared a picture of Bella, writing, "Forever love."

339.title: 6-yr-old girl abducted & raped by neighbour in Andhra, man arrested
339.article_body: A 20-year-old man allegedly abducted and raped a six-year-old girl in Andhra Pradesh's Anakapalle, a report said. The accused reportedly fled after committing the crime but was arrested by the police. The accused neighbour lured the minor girl when she had gone to relieve herself and took her to an abandoned place where he raped her, the report added.

340.title: Don't allow outsider to run Punjab: Anurag Thakur to CM Mann
340.article_body: Criticising the AAP government in Punjab, Union Minister Anurag Thakur asked Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann not to allow any 'outsider' to run Punjab, adding that the people would not accept it. "Punjab has given you power for reform, respect it. Respect the mandate of the people," he tweeted. Thakur's remarks came after Tajinder Bagga was arrested by the Punjab Police.

341.title: Train gets stranded for 2 hours after running over camel in MP
341.article_body: A Delhi-Bhopal Shatabdi Express train was stranded for around two hours after it ran over a camel in Madhya Pradesh's Morena district on Saturday. The train collided with the camel when it walked onto the track following which its parts got stuck in the engine, a Railway Protection Force official said. No passenger was injured in the incident, he added.

342.title: Jet Airways CEO lists 'things to avoid' for airlines after experience with foreign airline
342.article_body: Newly-appointed Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor shared a list of what airlines should avoid. It was based on his recent travel experience in Europe. "Things to avoid- 1) Staff travellers...checking in at business class counter, holding up the line. 2) Having to remind...non-smiling, no greeting agent to put priority tag. 3) Poor priority boarding process for stairs gate," he wrote.

343.title: 6 Indian nationals arrested from sinking boat while trying to illegally enter US
343.article_body: As many as six Indian nationals were arrested by US officials after they were apprehended on a sinking boat on a freezing river while allegedly trying to enter the US from Canada illegally. All the six persons apprehended were aged between 19 and 21 years and were charged with 'Improper Entry by Alien', according to reports.

344.title: 11 soldiers killed fighting terrorists near Suez Canal: Egypt
344.article_body: An Egyptian army spokesman on Saturday said that 11 soldiers were killed after clashing with a group of terrorists who attacked a water-lifting station east of the Suez Canal. "The terrorist elements are being chased and besieged in one of the isolated areas in Sinai," he added. Five others were also injured during the clash, the spokesman further said.

345.title: I'm product of pan-India home, worked in all industries: Shruti Haasan
345.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan in an interview has stated that she is a product of a pan-India home, adding that she has worked in the Hindi, Tamil and Telugu film industries. She further said that a pan-India movie has never felt like an unfathomable situation. "My dad (actor Kamal Haasan) had film premieres in Mumbai, Hyderabad and Chennai," the actress added.

346.title: BJP using political might to save a goon: Sisodia on Tajinder Bagga
346.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said that "BJP and its governments are using their political might to save a goon". Sisodia's comments come after BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga was arrested and released. Calling the BJP a "party of goons", he said that it never spoke about issues like education, health, inflation and unemployment.

347.title: Faulty battery cells caused e-scooter fires, govt probe reportedly finds
347.article_body: An initial investigation by a government agency into the recent electric scooter fires in India has found faulty battery cells and modules as the leading cause, Reuters reported. The probe reportedly looked into fire incidents involving Ola, Okinawa and Pure EV scooters. "In Ola's case, the battery cells were found to be an issue," Reuters quoted a source as saying.

348.title: Kim Sharma, Leander Paes to have court marriage: Report
348.article_body: Actress Kim Sharma and former tennis player Leander Paes will be tying the knot in a court marriage ceremony, reported The Times of India. As per the report, the couple's parents were in Mumbai at Leander's residence to discuss their wedding. The two have been in a relationship for over a year and celebrated their first anniversary on March 29.

349.title: Former Karnataka minister Pramod Madhwaraj quits Congress
349.article_body: Former Karnataka minister Pramod Madhwaraj quit the Congress party, stating that the situation in the Udupi district Congress had been a "bad experience" for him. In his resignation letter to KPCC President DK Shivakumar, he wrote that "no worthwhile steps" were taken for the redressal of his grievances. Madhwaraj served as the Minister of Fisheries in the Siddaramaiah-led government.

350.title: Video shows man shooting cigarette out of son's mouth with AK-47 in Iraq; criticised
350.article_body: A man is being criticised online after a video showed him shooting a cigarette out of his young son's mouth with what is said to be an AK-47 rifle in Iraq. The video shows the man telling the boy to hold the cigarette in his mouth before shooting it. Social media users called on local authorities to take action.

351.title: US directly involved in fighting in Ukraine: Russian lawmaker
351.article_body: Vyacheslav Volodin, the Chairman of the State Duma, on Saturday accused the US of directly participating in the conflict in Ukraine by coordinating military operations in the European country. Notably, Volodin's remark comes after US officials said that America had provided intelligence to Ukraine to help counter the Russian assault. The US has also provided military aid to Ukraine.

352.title: Sedition law needs no reconsideration: Centre asks SC to dismiss pleas against it
352.article_body: The Centre defended sedition law before Supreme Court saying that a 1962 verdict by a five-judge SC bench upholding the law is "binding, continues to be a good law and needs no reconsideration". It asked the apex court to dismiss the pleas challenging the validity of sedition, saying that a three-judge bench cannot hear a legal challenge to the law.

353.title: Stop tormenting people: WB CM to Centre on LPG cylinder price hike
353.article_body: Criticising the Centre over the LPG cylinder price hike, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee tweeted that the BJP-led central government is "tormenting" people by regularly raising the prices of essential commodities. "BJP is actually conducting a Great Indian Loot. People are being fooled," she tweeted. "Sad to see the media silent and blind", she added.

354.title: Mamata Banerjee very close to me: Sourav day after hosting Shah for dinner
354.article_body: A day after hosting Home Minister Amit Shah for dinner in Kolkata, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly on Saturday said, "Our honourable CM Mamata Banerjee is a person very close to me."
