Addressing the inauguration programme of a private hospital in Kolkata, Ganguly added, "I had taken the doctor who wanted to start this hospital [to her]. She immediately helped him."

355.title: Israeli soldiers demolish home of Palestinian assailant
355.article_body: The Israeli military on Saturday said that its troops had demolished the home of a Palestinian man who killed a Jewish seminary student in a shooting ambush in the occupied West Bank five months ago. Residents threw stones and firebombs at soldiers during the operation, the military added. In response, Israeli troops fired live rounds at them, it further said.

356.title: Who is Jared Birchall, who manages the world's richest man Elon Musk's wealth?
356.article_body: Jared Birchall is the Managing Director of Excession, the family office of the world's richest man Elon Musk that handles his almost $250 billion fortune. Birchall also serves various roles at the Musk Foundation, Musk's school Ad Astra and his brain-implant startup Neuralink, and several of Musk's other LLCs. He has recently helped Musk secure financing for $44-billion Twitter takeover.

357.title: My success is by-product of content-driven film: Nushrratt Bharuccha
357.article_body: Actress Nushrratt Bharuccha has stated that her success is a by-product of content-driven film, adding that the audience and good content made her who she is today. "Every character that I play, is just a real character, an interesting story...Whenever I heard a script, I listen to it as an audience...The change has come from the audience's side," Nushrratt said.

358.title: He'll lose Wayanad too: Owaisi on Rahul's challenge to AIMIM, TRS
358.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has challenged Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to contest from Hyderabad and Medak in next year's Telangana Assembly elections. He said, "I'm saying...(Rahul) will now lose from Wayanad too. Come, contest from Hyderabad. Try your luck. You can contest from Medak too." This comes after Gandhi, on Friday, said he'll challenge TRS, BJP and AIMIM in Telangana.

359.title: BJP doesn't want Congress to completely disappear: Union Minister HS Puri
359.article_body: The BJP doesn't want Congress to "completely disappear", Union Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has said, adding, "We need an opposition." Puri said, "If we have an opposition then the opposition has to decide whether it wants to be led by Rahul Gandhi, Mamata Banerjee, Arvind Kejriwal or Sharad Pawar." The opposition needs to "get its act together", he added.

360.title: Police mustn't be used to settle political scores: Congress' Hooda
360.article_body: Criticising the Centre and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) over BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga's arrest, Congress leader Deepender Hooda said, "Police should not be used to settle political scores." He added, "The police of three states were involved. There should be tolerance." A similar case happened with Jignesh Mevani in Assam, he added.

361.title: My biggest shortcoming is 'basic shot-making': SS Rajamouli
361.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli in an interview has revealed that his biggest shortcoming is "basic shot-making" since he has not worked as an assistant director on any film. "When I made my first film 'Student No.1', I didn't know how to use a crane...I still don't know what shot exactly gives me what I need," the filmmaker added.

362.title: Rare case of monkeypox detected in UK, govt lists symptoms
362.article_body: An individual, who has recent travel history from Nigeria, has been diagnosed with monkeypox in England, said the UK government. The rare viral infection can spread when someone is in close contact with an infected person; however, there's very low risk of transmission to general population. Initial symptoms include fever, headache, muscle aches, swollen lymph nodes, chills and exhaustion.

363.title: Delhi reports 1,407 new COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths; positivity rate at 4.72%
363.article_body: Delhi on Saturday reported 1,407 new cases of COVID-19 and two deaths in the last 24 hours. The national capital witnessed a slight dip in the daily positivity rate, which stood at 4.72% on Saturday, compared to 5.39% on Friday. The city reported 1,546 recoveries, while 4,365 patients are under home isolation.

364.title: US First Lady Jill Biden meets Ukrainian refugees in Romania
364.article_body: During a visit to Romania on Saturday, US First Lady Jill Biden met Ukrainian women and children who had fled the war in Ukraine. She praised the Romanian government and relief organisations for the humanitarian aid they are providing to refugees. Notably, over 9 lakh Ukrainians have fled to Romania since Russia launched its invasion.

365.title: Loudspeaker issue is over in Maharashtra: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut
365.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that the loudspeaker issue in Maharashtra was over. He said, "There is peace in Maharashtra, some people were trying to spoil the situation in the state but they have been given a befitting reply." He also called upon the Centre for a policy on the usage of loudspeakers for the entire country.

366.title: Train services between Bihar's Kosi & Mithila resume after 88 yrs
366.article_body: Train services between Bihar's Kosi and Mithila, which had stopped following the 1934 earthquake, have been restored after 88 years with the launch of a passenger train between Jhanjharpur and Nirmali. The train was virtually flagged off by Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Saturday. The train services will reduce the distance between Jhanjharpur to Saharsa by about 100 km.

367.title: KL Rahul gets out for diamond duck, IPL share video
367.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul was dismissed for a diamond duck on the fifth delivery of the first over against KKR on Saturday. Rahul got run out for 0(0) after a direct hit by KKR captain Shreyas Iyer. Rahul was sent back to the non-striker's end by Quinton De Kock who initially set off for a quick single.

368.title: Woman robbed of jewellery worth ₹1.2 lakh in Maha by 4 posing as policemen
368.article_body: Four unidentified persons allegedly robbed a 60-year-old woman of her jewellery worth ₹1.2 lakh in Maharashtra. The victim was travelling in an autorickshaw when the accused riding sports bikes intercepted her and flashed a fake identity card, posing as police personnel. The accused allegedly asked her to keep her jewellery safely in a packet and offered to help her pack.

369.title: Man dies after TN bar server beats him for throwing food on floor
369.article_body: A 35-year-old man died after a Tasmac bar attendant allegedly beat him following a quarrel about throwing food on the bar's floor in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore on Thursday. The victim "fainted and fell on the floor" after the incident and was taken to hospital for treatment, police said. He was then dropped at his house but he, however, died later.

370.title: BJP-RSS trying to rekindle 90s' era of hatred: Owaisi on Gyanvapi mosque survey
370.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Saturday criticised a Varanasi court's order allowing survey of some sections of Gyanvapi mosque. Owaisi also accused the BJP-RSS of rekindling "the era of hatred as the one in the 90s". "This order to survey the masjid is an open violation of Places of Worship Act 1991, which prohibits conversion of religious places," Owaisi added.

371.title: Never a choice, I admire her holistically: Palak on her standing by mom Shweta
371.article_body: Actress Palak Tiwari, speaking about standing by her mother actress Shweta Tiwari's side, stated that it was never a choice. She said that the only person she's admired holistically is her mother, adding she always prioritised the well-being of their family. "For me, she could do no wrong then and she could do no wrong now," Palak said.

372.title: It breaks my heart: Depp's ex-fiancee amid defamation trial with Heard
372.article_body: Johnny Depp's ex-fiancee Jennifer Grey has spoken about his ongoing defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard, saying it breaks her heart "for everybody involved". Jennifer added, "I just think it's sad and I wish it was resolved and I just wish everybody well." Depp has sued Heard following her 2018 op-ed piece about being a victim of domestic violence.

373.title: 25,000 litres of chemical used to make spurious liquor seized in MP
373.article_body: A tanker filled with around 25,000 litres of overproof chemical, which is commonly used for preparing spurious liquor, was seized from a warehouse in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri on the intervening night of Thursday and Friday. The chemical is reportedly worth around ₹5 crore. Police have booked two people associated with the inter-state liquor peddler group under provisions of Excise Act.

374.title: 3 Goa I-T officers sexually assault & threaten woman staff, booked
374.article_body: Three Income Tax inspectors in Goa's Panaji, who allegedly sexually assaulted a female staff, have been booked, police said, adding, they are yet to be arrested. Two of them had also threatened the victim to delete WhatsApp messages while the third outraged her modesty, police added. Police are investigating further and have sought CCTV footage from the Income Tax office.

375.title: 4 cheat MP villagers of ₹5 lakh using biometric machines, arrested
375.article_body: Cyber police in MP have arrested four persons for cheating over 30 villagers of ₹5 lakh using biometric machines. According to police, the gang's kingpin organised camps to prepare Ayushman cards, etc, and the accused helped villagers in opening bank accounts. They, however, stored their digital information in an application and later used it to siphon money from villagers' accounts.

376.title: Who is IAS officer Pooja Singhal, being investigated in ₹18 cr fraud in J'khand?
376.article_body: Jharkhand Mining Secretary Pooja Singhal is being investigated by ED in a money laundering case linked to alleged embezzlement of ₹18-crore MGNREGA funds. The 2000 batch IAS officer had reportedly cleared UPSC at 21 and was the Agriculture Secretary in the previous BJP government. She's been accused of financial irregularities during her tenure as Deputy Commissioner of three different districts.

377.title: 2 workers killed, 3 injured in accident at Tidong Hydropower Project in Himachal
377.article_body: Two workers died and three others sustained injuries in a major accident at Tidong Hydropower Project in Himachal Pradesh's Kinnaur on Saturday morning. As per information, the five workers were travelling in a trolley inside the tunnel when it reportedly slipped off from the track and fell deep inside. ITBP personnel rescued the three injured workers trapped inside the tunnel.

378.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperature today released
378.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) released a list of cities that recorded 42°C or more as their maximum temperature on Saturday. Rajasthan's Barmer recorded the highest maximum temperature at 45°C, followed by Phalodi (44.6°C). Both Bikaner and Maharashtra's Jalgaon recorded maximum temperature of 44.5°C. A maximum temperature of 44.4°C was recorded in Jaisalmer.

379.title: Diplomats express concern over state of emergency in Sri Lanka
379.article_body: Diplomats and rights groups on Saturday raised their concerns over a state of emergency imposed by Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa in the country. Under the emergency regulations, Rajapaksa can authorise detentions, seize possession of property and search any premises. Notably, this comes after protests erupted against him over the handling of the economic crisis in the country.

380.title: RR record their first successful chase in IPL 2022, end their 2-match losing streak
380.article_body: RR chased down the target of 190 runs in 19.4 overs against PBKS to record their first successful run chase in IPL 2022. With the victory, RR ended their two-match losing streak. Yashasvi Jaiswal top-scored for RR with 68(41), while their leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal registered bowling figures of 4-0-28-3.

381.title: Bag maker ESBEDA fined ₹38,000 for charging customer ₹20 for its carry bag in Mumbai
381.article_body: A Mumbai District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission has fined bag maker ESBEDA for charging a customer ₹20 for its carry bag in 2019, which was branded with the company's logo. The commission asked the company to pay the customer ₹13,000 towards litigation expenses and compensation. Moreover, it was asked to deposit ₹25,000 with the consumer welfare fund.

382.title: Anonymity is an 'inherent risk' in use of blockchain tech: FM Sitharaman
382.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said anonymity is an "inherent risk" in use of blockchain technology and urged people to take precaution in future with a rise in the use of this technology. Calling distributed ledger technology (DLT) "beautiful", she added, "Unless we...guard ourselves against that anonymous element...we'll be exposing ourselves much more than...we would've imagined."

383.title: 'Got a call saying I'm laid off,' says woman days before she was due to join Meta
383.article_body: In a widely-shared LinkedIn post, Stephanie Washington, who was hired as a Recruiting Coordinator for Meta, said she was laid off just days before she was due to join the workplace. "I just signed...apartment lease 15 minutes before my manager called me...They are only compensating us for six weeks of pay after a month-long process of interviews," she wrote.

384.title: Railway staff risks life to restart train on bridge as passenger pulls alarm chain
384.article_body: Railways Ministry shared a video of an employee risking his life to restart a train that was halted over a river bridge after a passenger pulled the alarm chain. The video shows Central Railways' Assistant Loco Pilot Satish Kumar resetting Godan Express' alarm chain by going under it. "Pulling the...chain for no reason can cause trouble to many," said Railways.

385.title: Govt aims to set up vehicle scrapyards within 150 kms of city centres
385.article_body: The government aims to develop at least one automobile scrapping facility within 150 kilometres of each city centre, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said on Saturday. India has the potential to become vehicle scrapping hub of South Asia, Gadkari added. The National Automobile Scrappage Policy allows all types and sizes of investors to come and establish scrapping centres, he further said.

386.title: KKR to bowl first against LSG, both teams make one change each
386.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer won the toss and elected to bowl first against LSG. Both the sides have made one change each. Harshit Rana has replaced Umesh Yadav in KKR's playing XI, while Avesh Khan has replaced Krishnappa Gowtham in LSG's playing XI. LSG are currently second on the IPL 2022 points table, while KKR are placed eighth.

387.title: 5 dead, 1 critical as vehicle crashes into truck from behind in Maharashtra
387.article_body: Five persons were killed, while a two-year-old girl had a miraculous escape, when a speeding multi-utility vehicle rammed into a truck from behind in Maharashtra, a police officer said. Another person was left critically injured in the incident, the officer added. The accident took place when the vehicle was on its way towards Nagpur from Umred.

388.title: I wasn't treated properly, didn't get the respect I deserved: Chris Gayle on snubbing IPL
388.article_body: Talking about not giving his name for IPL mega auction earlier this year, Chris Gayle said, "For the last couple of years...the way the IPL went about, I felt...I wasn't treated properly." He added he didn't get the respect he deserved after doing "so much" for the sport and IPL. Notably, Gayle had pulled out of IPL 2021 mid-way.

389.title: Mumbai chicken delivery boy arrested for molesting 3 persons, including minor girl
389.article_body: Police, while questioning a 24-year-old youth arrested in a molestation case, found that two previous cases of molestation were registered against him, including one involving a minor girl. In one case, the accused, a Mumbai-based chicken delivery boy, had reportedly tried to enter the complainant's house after delivering chicken and kept staring at her and tried to open her door.

390.title: Sex racket running through secret door in toilet busted in K'taka; woman seen coming out
390.article_body: A prostitution racket which was running through a small secret door inside a toilet has been busted, with Chitradurga police arresting three people in Karnataka. The accused used the secret door to let in the "customers", according to reports. A video has also surfaced showing a woman coming out of the door.

391.title: John Mulaney told me to spread 'Kanye has polio' rumours: Pete
391.article_body: Comedian Pete Davidson has revealed that John Mulaney told him to spread the rumour that his girlfriend Kim Kardashian's ex-husband rapper Kanye West has polio. As per reports, Kanye had spread rumours in January that Pete is a gay man who contracted AIDS. "AIDS is such an old-school-like thing...It's just such a '90s, early 2000s thing to [come at me]."

392.title: Dave Chappelle getting a** whipped needed to happen: Kevin Hart
392.article_body: Comedian Kevin has reacted to comedian Dave Chappelle being attacked onstage during his show, saying that it "needed to happen". "Somebody getting their ass whipped sends a message out to the other people," Kevin added. He further said that there are "a lot of lines that have gotten blurred" and people shouldn't continue to think they can "break the barrier".

393.title: I was 110kg & wanted to act, relatives said someone did witchcraft: Manoj
393.article_body: Actor Manoj Pahwa has revealed that ahead of his acting debut, his relatives said "someone has done some kind of witchcraft" on him as he was "110 kg overweight and [wants] to become a hero". Manoj further said that he was labelled a comedian and "got frustrated" with the film roles he was offered before 'Article 15' and 'Mulk'.

394.title: Rare tornado witnessed in Assam, video goes viral
394.article_body: A low-intensity tornado was captured in videos in a village in Assam's Barpeta on Saturday. The tornado, a rare occurrence in these parts, is seen tearing through a field and some huts in the video. Locals said they saw a clear swirling column of air carrying dust and debris. There were no immediate reports of loss of life or property.

395.title: CBI searches premises of Punjab AAP MLA Jaswant in ₹40 crore bank fraud case
395.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) is carrying out searches at the premises of AAP MLA Jaswant Singh Gajjan Majra in an alleged ₹40 crore bank fraud case, officials said on Saturday. The searches are being conducted at three locations in Sangrur, including the Malerkotla area, which is the ancestral home of the Amargarh MLA, officials added.

396.title: Punjab court issues fresh arrest warrant against BJP's Bagga a day after release
396.article_body: A Mohali court on Saturday issued fresh warrants for BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga's arrest, a day after he was released from Punjab Police's custody and brought back to Delhi. The court instructed the police to produce Bagga before it. Bagga was arrested on Friday for allegedly making provocative statements and 'threatening' AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal during a protest.

397.title: Supreme Court gets 2 more judges, set to regain full strength of 34
397.article_body: The Supreme Court is set to regain its full strength of 34 judges with two appointments to the top court on Saturday. The Union Law Ministry announced Gauhati High Court Chief Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia and Gujarat High Court Justice JB Pardiwala's appointments in separate notifications. This comes days after the Supreme Court Collegium recommended the names for elevation to SC.

398.title: Pic of notice on separate lift for 'house maids' in Pune society sparks debate
398.article_body: A notice asking domestic helps and service personnel to use only the lift assigned to them in a Pune housing society has sparked a debate on Twitter. "It's less about the so-called maintenance, it's more about the 'mental comfort' of the orthodox residents," a user said. Some people argued that separate lift was assigned because workers stopped on every floor.

399.title: ₹2.65 lakh cr spent on projects in Northeast from 2014-2021: Govt
399.article_body: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai on Friday said that more than ₹2.65 lakh crore had been spent on various infrastructure projects in the Northeast from 2014 to 2021. "The result of which is visible in...form of development," he added. Separately, Rai also said that there's been a vast improvement in the security situation in the Northeast.

400.title: KT Rama Rao reviews Hyderabad civic body's development projects
400.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao reviewed development projects undertaken by Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) and other departments and advised authorities to complete the monsoon season plan. Officials said that the minister took stock of the progress of the construction of link roads in Hyderabad, the strategic canal development programme and the construction of Hyderabad roads.

401.title: Police raid gambling den in Hyderabad, 9 arrested
401.article_body: The Rachakonda Police said that nine people have been arrested on charges of gambling. Playing cards and cash were also seized from the accused, the police said. "The LB Nagar Police nabbed Gaming Act offenders, seized one cell phone, 27 playing cards, and net cash of ₹7,980," Rachakonda Police added.

402.title: We don't support murderers: Owaisi on murder of man by wife's relatives in Hyd
402.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has condemned the killing of 25-year-old Hindu man Nagaraju, who was allegedly lynched by his Muslim wife's relatives over their marriage on a busy road in Hyderabad. Owaisi added that the woman had married willingly and her family had no right to kill her husband. "We do not support murderers," Owaisi further said.
